name: Blue Khepra
text: Made with exotic sapphires, crafted into the shape of the flesh-eating Khepra beetle, this brooch protects the wearer from any baleful magic directed against them.

name: Enkhil's Kanopi
text: The simple clay vessel may not look like much, but the High Priest's Undying essence within can thwart sorcery and strengthen incantations.

name: Neferra's Scrolls of Mighty Incantations
text: These eight magical scrolls, containing the sum total of Neferra's lifetime of learning, can whip up an unstoppable hurricane of power to crush the foe.

name: Staff of Nagash
text: Created by the Arch-Necromancer, the staff harnesses Dark Magic from deep within the accursed Black Pyramid.

name: The Liche Staff
text: All of Nehekhara's gods and goddesses are inscribed along the ancient copper staff, granting Khatep mastery over their latent magical power.

name: Armour of Dawn
text: Those who don this enchanted plate armour gain Geheb's strength and favour, enabling them to parry a normally-lethal blow with a seemingly-lucky deflection.

name: Helmet of Khsar
text: This helm, inscribed with an invocation to the malign Desert-God, so that his savage ferocity may overtake its wearer.

name: Mortuary Robes
text: "…and their vestments shall contain a writing which no man knoweth."

name: Armour of Eternity
text: Forged from bronze, cooled in the blood of the giant Lybrasian scorpion, and gilded in red and Lahmian gold, this ancient breastplate will turn aside all but the strongest of blows.

name: Armour of the Ages
text: This armour imbues its wearer with the ability to continue fighting even when mortally wounded.

name: Shield of Ptra
text: This mystical shield channels white-hot energy from the Sun-God, unleashing it in a blinding flash of light.

name: Skull Cap of the Moon
text: This small, blue cap is adorned with prayers to Neru, so she may have special care for its wearer's precious head.

name: Scorpion Armour
text: These ornate armour plates are decorated with the likeness of the Scorpion-God; his protective energies pervade the very metal used, offering additional protection to the wearer.

name: Brooch of the Great Desert
text: The elaborate piece of jewellery hampers the effectiveness of Dark Magic ranged against it.

name: Cloak of the Dunes
text: The desert itself shall be your coat... and the foe's undoing.

name: Death Mask of Kharnut
text: Having witnessed the doom of thousands over the course of the centuries, death's fell taint hangs heavy upon Prince Kharnut's expressionless mask, with terror forever close behind.

name: Elixir of Might
text: One sip of the elixir fills the body of its drinker with the strength of many powerful, elite warriors.

name: Golden Death Mask of Kharnut
text: Death's foul taint hangs heavy from Prince Kharnut's elaborate deathmask, gripping the hearts of those who gaze upon it and freezing them in terror.

name: Hieratic Jar
text: Sealed and bound with powerful glyphs, this jar contains the remains of a Liche Priest and all the magical energy at his command.

name: Icon of Rulership
text: This Hero's victories are recorded on a mighty totemic pole that pulses with an aura of greatness.

name: Lucky Skullhelm
text: This charmed helmet, fashioned from the skull of a slaughtered foe, protects Tretch from blows of all kinds, be they physical or magical.

name: Ouroboros
text: The coils of the serpent wind around its prey, injecting its venom and granting its bearer regenerative abilities.

name: Shroud of Sokth
text: This dark, ragged shroud is imbued with Sokth's treacherous essence, enabling them to stalk their enemies unseen until the final moment.

name: The Crown of Nehekhara
text: Effectively several crowns in one, this regal headdress instils Settra's unyielding will within those nearby who serve him.

name: Vambraces of the Sun
text: Infused with the sun's dazzling intensity, the power harnessed within gleams brilliantly, blinding the wearer's opponents.

name: Acolyte of Sokth
text: Treachery - and indeed scorpion-husbandry - can be taught and learned like many other skills.

name: Charnel Valley Necrotect
text: The man who designed the Tomb Kings' elaborate crypts and vaults was just far too skilled to be allowed to rest in his own.

name: Cultist of Usirian
text: Bearing witness to men's downfall, he judges their worthiness to serve his master-deity from beyond the grave.

name: Dog-Headed Ushabti
text: What courageous heart has he who serves the God of Earth and Strength.

name: Herald of Djaf
text: The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

name: Herald of Khemri
text: The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

name: Herald of Mahrak
text: With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

name: Herald of Rasetra
text: Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

name: Herald of the Scorpion
text: Blessed by Sokth himself, the Scorpion Guard could shrug off mortal blows and carve through infantry with horrifying efficiency.

name: Herald of the Sphinx
text: Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

name: Herald of Zandri
text: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

name: High-Born of Khemri
text: Khemri's noble class still possess much of their former presence and power, even after death.

name: Legionnaire of Asaph
text: This knot of life at once untie: poor venomous fool, be angry and dispatch.

name: Priest of Ptra
text: The acolytes of the Great Father wield his burning power in Ptra's name, their skin shining brilliantly in the white-hot desert sun.

name: Skeletal Labourer
text: Where once he dug graves, now he toils eternally.

name: Tombfleet Taskmaster
text: As if the Tomb Kings' skeletal slave-sailors were not obedient and tireless enough, an extremely hard taskmaster whips them into shape and on to greater achievement.

name: Ushabti Bodyguard
text: An imposing monument to Nehekhara's former power, now living once again in service of its Lords.

name: Banner of the Hidden Dead
text: This banner is wrought with powerful incantations that draw the ancient dead to it and bind their souls to the remains of long-dead warriors.

name: Standard of the Undying Legion
text: Containing the spirits of King Lahmizzar's Jackal Legion, this banner restores the fallen so they might fulfil their undying pledge.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Necroserpent
text: A reward for utter dedication to the Warrior-Queen, every swipe of its sandstone tail can carve through mortal flesh.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Casket of Souls
text: When the souls are released they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Chariot of the Gods
text: Its wheels ablaze with a mystical flame, the blessings of the gods are carried by this mighty chariot.

name: Khemrian Warsphinx
text: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Khemrian Warsphinx
text: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

name: Skeleton Chariot
text: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

name: Amulet of Pha-Stah
text: This moon-shaped amulet projects a disruptive magical energy onto the enemy's defences.

name: Collar of Shakkhara
text: Crafted within the labyrinthine necropolis at Shakkhara, this elaborate piece gives the High Liche Priest additional protection against harm unseen.

name: Golden Ankhra
text: This Nehekharan symbol of eternity surrounds its wearer with a protective aura of magical energy.

name: Golden Eye of Rah-Nutt
text: This sigil, carved into the war chariot of King Rah-Nutt, caused arrows and spears glance harmlessly away as he rode into battle.

name: Obsidian Pendant
text: This powerful item contains just enough essence from a malevolent elemental spirit to weaken the foe's magical attack.

name: Sun Scarab
text: This precious stone glows with the rising of the sun, gifting its bearer with the Great Father's divine protection.

name: Blade of Antarhak
text: This Tomb Prince's magical sword draws lifeforce from the slain to imbue the body of its wielder with stolen essence.

name: Blade of Mourning Fire
text: Forged in the heart of Settra's pyramid, only sorrow and despair are left behind when this enchanted blade has done its deadly work.

name: Blade of Setep
text: The very late King Setep's ornamented, curved sword shimmers with a blue hue that shatters the foe's armour.

name: Crook & Flail of Radiance
text: All in the presence of these weapons' bearer are strangely humbled by the aura of majesty they convey.

name: Destroyer of Eternities
text: This enchanted, impossibly-sharp blade can cleave through armour, flesh, bone and souls with equal ease, reducing victims to a lifeless husk.

name: Double Crescent of Neru
text: This enchanted stave is blessed by Neru, Goddess of the Moon, who comes each night to protect the sons of the gods.

name: Enchanted Lapis Mace
text: A spell of enchantment gives this cudgel, gilded with precious stones, additional power - as if any were needed!

name: Fang of Qu'aph
text: Beware the venomous bite of the Cobra-God.

name: Gold Dagger
text: This deceptive little blade has some nasty uses that belie its ceremonial origins.

name: Inscribed Khopesh
text: Its curved blade, designed to hook shields, heads and tentacles, is balanced with one blunt edge to quickly batter the entrapped foe to death.

name: Spear of Pakth
text: This spear imbues the bearer with the Sky-God's decisiveness when dispensing swift, brutal justice without haste.

name: The Blessed Blade of Ptra
text: Blessed by the God of the Sun, the sword's white-hot edge is infused with the desert's baking heat, setting the air itself ablaze and blinding the foe.

name: The Tomb Blade of Arkhan
text: The sword burns away the flesh of Arkhan's victims, leaving nothing but a charred skeleton, bound to the Liche King's dark will for all eternity.

name: The Venom Staff
text: Fashioned into the shape of a striking asp, the staff writhes and spits with the spiteful anger of Asaph, Goddess of Vengeance.

name: Burning Phoenix Pinion
text: The slaughtered sentinel passes on its natural abilities to the one who killed it; terrified opponents will be consumed by a fiery inferno.

name: Extinguished Phoenix Pinion
text: The Phoenix is constantly ablaze with magical flames; when extinguished, this item confers the very same resistance to fire upon the bearer.

name: Cauldron of Blood
text: A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Manticore
text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral death indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Black Dragon
text: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

text: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Manticore
text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Carnosaur Skull
text: As the mighty predator was in life, so too will its killer be, whilst they carry its bones, at least.

name: Hydra Head
text: The head of a many-necked beast, severed in single combat. Will carrying it grant a boon or a curse?

name: Sword of Khaine (Thirsting)
text: The mighty Sword of Khaine! A weapon of untold power - think of the greatness that can be achieved!

name: Sword of Khaine (Thriving)
text: Khaine's sword has bonded with its owner; together they are one. Now, ambition turns to dominance…

name: Sword of Khaine (Dominating)
text: The wielder of the Sword of Khaine is the ultimate warrior whom none dare challenge, be they friend or foe. All will kneel!

name: Warpstone Teeth
text: Taken from an abomination of Skaven grafting and artifice; such teeth grant an insatiable hunger.

name: Alaric's Armour
text: The lost forging techniques of Alaric the Mad have been rediscovered, enabling the creation of this wonderous armour.

name: Dragon Slayer's Scales
text: Eschewing armour, Dragon Slayers will instead take the scales of slain Drakes for a modicum of protection.

name: Gatekeeper's Helm
text: The Gatekeepers are rightly seen as living bastions; those that wear this helm are talismans of sanctuary.

name: Ironbeard's Armour
text: Expensive and coveted Gromril plate, forged by Master Runesmiths and worth a kingly price.

name: Ironwarden's Shield
text: A massive tower-shield usually taken into battle by Iron Wardens. Its bulk is worth the protection it provides.

name: Miner's Helm
text: A helmet of older design that is said to imbue its wearer with the courage of the Grungni.

name: Old Guard's Armour
text: Heavy plate-mail warn by the dedicated guardians and Kingsguard who serve the most ancient Karaks.

name: Prospector's Mail
text: The preferred mail of scouts and prospectors alike, this armour is wrought with unique runes of stealth.

name: Ranger's Cloak
text: Rangers' cloaks are entwined with runes of concealment and warding.

name: Slayer's Bracers
text: Gold-plated bracelets inscribed with runes that mirror the tattoos of the greatest Slayers to ensure a swift killing blow.

name: Starmetal Plate
text: Using a rarefied ore of Gromril, and the finest forging techniques, crafting such mail will make the wearer all but impervious to attack.

name: Troll Slayer's Hide
text: The hide of felled beast, now inscribed with tattoos of protection.

name: Veteran's Armour
text: Fine Dwarfen plate-mail, crafted from iron and precious gromril ore.

name: Dragon Slayer's Boots
text: These boots are made for walking… and fighting and slaying!

name: Gatekeeper's Belt
text: A strong, thick belt; perfect for beard-tuckers and flask-holders everywhere.

name: Horn of the Ancestors
text: Blowing on this ancient horn will summon a legendary Ancestor back from Valaya's bosom to aid in the fight.

name: Ironbeard's Bracers
text: Large iron bands wrapped around the Ironbeard's wrist to deflect enemy strikes.

name: Ironwarden's Tankard
text: Said to contain a bottomless mug of Bugman's XXXXXX; not so much a yard of ale, as a league!

name: Miner's Drinking Horn
text: Miners come up from the deeps very thirsty, so appreciate a nice, large horn.

name: Old Guard's Keg
text: A Dawi with a few beers in him is even braver than your average guard!

name: Prospector's Spyglass
text: Dwarfs excel at crafting lenses, making their spy-glasses the envy of all umgi, except Elves, the gits.

name: Ranger's Broach
text: This piece of jewellery is a small ornamentation that often carries a beneficial ward or fortune.

name: Sceptre of Stone
text: Bound within this mighty sceptre is the power to move the mountain peaks themselves.

name: Slayer's Belt
text: Not only useful for holding up pantaloons and for tucking your beard in, but great for carrying your axe in too.

name: Troll Slayer's Gauntlets
text: Massive mittens, banded in iron and laced with runes of swiftness; they are perfect for getting in that early kill which Slayer's crave.

name: Veteran's Gauntlets
text: The gloves of a veteran are made to fit those thick, dextrous hands that are the mark of a true Dawi warrior.

name: Dragon Slayer's Fang
text: An amulet made of a Dragon's fang is a reminder that no matter how vicious the beast, it *will* fall.

name: Gatekeeper's Rat Catcher
text: An amulet awarded to the Chief Rat-Catcher - not as mundane a task as it sounds when Skaven are the foe.

name: Ironbeard's Ring
text: Such a ring is wrought in runes of cooling, allowing its bearer a certain immunity from fire.

name: Ironwarden's Wardstone
text: A Wardstone, like an Oathstone, is a great, revered rock. This one is inscribed with runes of warding.

name: Miner's Lantern
text: Great jewels can be found in the deeps, as long as there is light to illuminate the seams.

name: Old Guard's Tankard
text: This tankard is large and deep; when filled, only the eldest of Longbeards can sup from it.

name: Prospector's Charge
text: This charge is created with the driest, and most potent, of black powders.

name: Ranger's Pouch
text: What mysteries are found inside the Ranger's Pouch? Not everyone is brave enough to find out…

name: Ring of Grimnir
text: A thick ring of Oathgold, created using words of fury once spoken by Grimnir himself.

name: Slayer's Ring
text: This freshly-smelted ring has the words of the Slayer Oath in Klinkarhun along its diameter.

name: The Ankor Chain
text: A talisman worn upon a thick chain that imbues its wearer with the courage of every High King of Everpeak.

name: Troll Slayer's Amulet
text: A trinket of the Slayers that feeds into their anger, hate and suffering.

name: Veteran's Flask
text: A flask that contains a spicy, salty brew blessed by Valaya herself.

name: Dragon Slayer's Axe
text: Forged in the breath of a captured ice drake; a chosen axe of any Dragon Slayer.

name: Elfbane
text: Rightly feared by the elgi, Elfbane's runes have been fashioned to cleave through Elven flesh with ease.

name: Gatekeeper's Hammer
text: Anyone who wields such a hammer acquires a grim resolve to fight on, regardless of their wounds.

name: Ironbeard's Axe
text: The axe of an Ironbreaker veteran is often imbued with runes of flaming fury.

name: Ironwarden's Hammer
text: All Dawi that witness the Ironwarden wielding this mighty hammer in action are roused to war.

name: Miner's Pickaxe
text: They say a miner's pick can shatter anything it strikes! A grand claim, but one that has not yet proven false…

name: Old Guard's Hammer
text: This weapon is forged with a certain hammerhead that is excellent for cracking open the worthless heads of Skaven and Greenskins.

name: Prospector's Pickaxe
text: A hardened gromril spike ensures this pick can prize out any gem or eye, no matter how deeply embedded.

name: Ranger's Hammer
text: This hammer will add strength and zeal to the weapon arm of any Dwarf wielding it.

name: Slayer's Axe
text: A mighty axe covered in vengeful runes that's as desperate to fulfil the Slayer Oath as its owner.

name: Starbreaker
text: Created by Grungni himself, Starbreaker is among the most powerful of all Dawi weapons.

name: Troll Slayer's Axe
text: An axe worthy a great Slayer, tempered to break through tough Troll skin.

name: Veteran's Hammer
text: Veterans have honed their weapons to within a whisker of perfection; they know a hammer's heft, making them perfectly balanced.

name: The Bordeleaux Flabellum
text: This enchanted fan keeps Cylostra cool when the heat is on, improving the recharge of her abilities and reducing their cooldown times.

name: Armour of the Deep
text: Fashioned from interlocking tentacles and seashells and permanently dripping with slime, this armour clings to the wearer's body, allowing them to move freely.

name: Sea-Dragon Buckler
text: Every pirate's favourite, this buckler is layered with Sea-Dragon scales which provide reliable protection yet weigh virtually nothing.

name: The Gunnarsson Kron
text: Fortunately, this volume, containing every slight made against the Dawi on the high seas, has been made with runes of waterproofing.

name: Black Buckthorn's Treasure Map
text: A long-lost treasure map, leading to long-lost treasure. Due to its accuracy and level of detail, it can also double as a battle map.

name: Captain Roth's Moondial
text: This particular moondial enables its owner to pull off seemingly-impossible feats of navigation and piloting.

name: Moonshine
text: The classic pirate brew. It makes one extremely fiery... in every way!

name: Pyrotechnic Compound
text: These incendiary chemicals give ordinary shot that special glow as it flies towards the target, turning them into a screaming, staggering torch on contact.

name: Slann Gold
text: It is well known that Lustrian gold is enchanted with all manner of esoteric properties; Harkon thinks it will restore his fractured mind!

name: Captain Drekla
text: The right hand of Luthor Harkon, which is somewhat ironic, since he lost his own left hand following the Vampire Admiral into battle.

name: Ship's Carpenter
text: If you're going to take a wooden ship to war, it makes sense to bring someone skilled in its repair too.

name: Unliving Ship's Cook
text: "Actually, these garlic crabs aren't 'alf bad - pass the salt, Bernard."

name: First Mate
text: Every captain needs a reliable functionary at their shoulder to advise and convey orders to the crew.

name: Master Gunner
text: This one can take the head off the enemy captain from fifty yards away.

name: Powder Monkey
text: It's an extremely dirty and dangerous job, but someone has to do it. After all, even the highest-rated admiral had to start somewhere.

name: Quartermaster
text: A first-class brain on the problem and a firm hand on the tiller.

name: Sartosan Mapwright
text: Someone with lifelong, intimate knowledge of the seas and coasts, and a little artistic flair, can prove most useful.

name: Seascape Artist
text: It says something about a commander that they feel the need to capture their actions for posterity, don't you think?

name: Boy Seaman
text: I think we can safely say that his will be a *very* long apprenticeship.

name: Siren
text: The ethereal voice of the siren calms the dead souls, allowing the Necromancer to bind them more easily.

name: Ship's Necromancer
text: All this one needs is a small space, off to one side, and plenty of samples to work with.

name: The Ravenous Dead
text: As the Undead rip apart their victims they feast on the organs that spill forth – regaining strength in the process.

name: Bloodied Banner of Slayers
text: The former owners of this banner have no further use for it themselves…

name: Boatswain's Burgees
text: "Right, you truly 'orrible lot - bring a spring upon 'her… now!!!"

name: Burnt Banner of Knights
text: "Ah, the cavalry's here! Yarrrr!!!"

name: War Standard o' the Corpse Surgeons
text: You'd think there'd be no need for surgery on a ship crewed by the dead, but you'd be wrong - someone who can sew limbs back on double-quick is worth their weight in grog!

name: Dead Man's Chest
text: The owner of this chest refuses to let go of it even though they're dead.

name: Holed Banner of Militia
text: "Never give the zombies explosives, they'll blow the whole ship apart - you, me, the loot... everything!"

name: Gonfalon o' the Green Hands
text: Although no substitute for experience, enthusiasm goes a long way.

name: Ship's Colours
text: "How many of 'em 'ave we sunk now? Is anyone counting? Can any of you count?"

name: Skull & Crossbones
text: In these days of grand alliances and complex treaties, there is something to be said for making your intentions abundantly clear from the outset.

name: Spell of the Necromancer's Apprentice
text: Practice makes perfect, in Dark Magic as in all things.

name: Throwing Bombs
text: "Now! Throw it now! Don't drop it, you bilge-sucking loon! You'll blow us all to..."

name: Torn Banner of Pilgrims
text: These lost souls follow only the tides and currents now.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: A giant Undead crab, whose pincers can tear ships apart, makes an impressive and fitting mount for the earthly offspring of Manann himself.

name: Necrofex Colossus
text: This gigantic, reanimated hulk of flesh, timber and stone is one of the most fearsome things ever to lurch onto a battlefield.

name: Rotting Leviathan
text: Very large and dead, yet still exceedingly dangerous; whoever sits astride this carnivorous crustacean must be *extremely* confident of their power.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Rotting Promethean
text: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.

name: Death Shriek Terrorgheist
text: Harkon's personal mount is a dreadful thing indeed - a Terrorgheist with a piercing, banshee-like shriek that has the power to stun any who hear it.

name: Maelstrom
text: This terrifying Black Dragon,  Fellheart's favourite mount, belches noxious fumes in place of fire as it carries the Krakenlord to battle.

name: Imperial Griffon
text: A Griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Terrorgheist
text: Deadly giant bats the size of dragons, capable of plucking men from the field and stunning warhorses into paralysis.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Blackpearl False Eye
text: Crafted from the highest-quality blackpearl, legends state that its wearer will be granted the ability to see through the black ocean waters all the way to the sea floor, where untold fortunes are buried.

name: Jellyfish in a Jar
text: "It won't kill yer - again - but the pain will make you wish it had."

name: Kraken Tusk
text: A small dagger made from the tusk of a ferocious sea monster, as cold as the ocean is deep.

name: Double Barrel
text: Twice the firepower. Comes with a guide on how to load both barrels at the same time… if only more of the crew could read!

name: Krakens' Bane
text: So named for its ability, in the right hands, to bring down one of the most - if not *the* most - savage sea monsters in existence.

name: Lucky Levi's Hookhand
text: From years of sword fighting, or maybe just a moment's rum luck when a pistol backfired, real hands are nevertheless in short supply among pirates.

name: Massa-Moones' Pride
text: This eastern pirate blade, unmatched in its lethal sharpness, imbues its new owner with a portion of its previous wielder's power and skill.

name: Red Blades
text: These blades gain their red hue from both the Indan Bloodsteel from which they are forged and the viscera which so often covers them.

name: Morgiana's Mirror
text: Through which the Lady's worldly representative peers directly into the hearts and minds of enemy Wizards, so she might prepare her defence.

name: Standard of the Sacred Serpent
text: A huge golden serpent coiled around a standard-pole, which comes to life writhing, hissing and spitting when the bearer's enemies approach.

name: Alloy Shield
text: A sturdy and lightweight double-plated alloy, applicable to most armour types and optimised for missile fire.

name: Armour of Brilliance
text: The smallest crack of light is reflected into the foe's eyes, so the merest glance of their opponent is so painful they dare not look at them directly.

name: Glyph of Potec
text: Lord Kroak's spirit is vulnerable to supernatural forces, so his bindings are inscribed with the arcane glyph, increasing damage caused to Undead aggressors.

name: Iron Frame
text: A mighty metal frame encases the Warlock Engineer's body, giving him amazing strength, dexterity and resistance against both physical and magical harm.

name: Power Armour
text: This painstakingly forged Warpstone-charged armour may appear unstable and is even heavier than obsidian, but can absorb a great deal of damage.

name: Sniper's Cape
text: A sturdy leather cape for the well-prepared Skaven sniper, complete with purpose-built inner pockets for scopes and ammunition.

name: Incendiary Rounds
text: Individual bullets are infused with explosive compounds and delayed triggers, which react with flesh to detonate on impact.

name: Homing Rounds
text: Not just heat-seeking bullets – cutting-edge Warpstone technology gives this ammunition temperature sensors that even allow the tracking of cold-blooded targets.

name: Braid of Bordeleaux
text: The bearer may channel Manann's power and energy by cradling this lock of his hair, entwined with kelp and shells, in their hand whilst invoking the Sea-God's terrible name.

name: Golden Death Mask
text: Lord Kroak’s death mask protects the mummified head of the venerable Relic Priest. The hypnotic effect of the mask hinders any and all foes trying to attack him.

name: Mask of Heavens
text: Its wearer will become one with the mighty Terradons, who will then move in tandem as a single, mighty consciousness.

name: Plaque of Sotek
text: Upon this stone plaque is inscribed an extract of the Prophecy of Sotek that grants additional warding to Tehenhauin.

name: Warp Lightning Battery
text: Stores the energy harnessed from Warp Lightning, providing incredible power boosts to enable a whole lot of zapping.

name: Modulated Doomwheel Assembly Kit
text: Ikit’s self-published manual gives almost comprehensible instruction on how to break a Doomwheel down into its most mass-producible form.

name: Ancient Stegadon
text: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

name: Horned One
text: Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.

name: Ripperdactyl
text: Unique and terrifying flying reptiles that are just as much a danger to their riders as the enemy!

name: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)
text: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

name: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)
text: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

name: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)
text: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

name: Horned One
text: Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.

name: Ripperdactyl
text: Unique and terrifying flying reptiles that are just as much a danger to their riders as the enemy!

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)
text: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Ancient Stegadon (Engine of the Gods)
text: Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Doom-Flayer
text: A motorised ball of whirling, razor-sharp, eviscerating death, designed to plough through enemy lines with hellish vigour.

name: Doomwheel
text: Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!

name: Doom-Flayer
text: A motorised ball of whirling, razor-sharp, eviscerating death, designed to plough through enemy lines with hellish vigour.

name: Doomwheel
text: Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!

name: Amulet of Itza
text: This lizard-shaped crystal amulet protects Lord Kroak's mummified remains from hostile magic spells by dispelling them harmlessly.

name: Warp Field Generator
text: Warp fields are a curious phenomenon, bending the flightpath of nearby projectiles and administering nasty shocks to anything in their proximity.

name: Blade of the Serpent's Tongue
text: This sacrificial dagger was crafted by the most skilled of Chaqua’s Skink artificers and enchanted to drip with deadly venom!

name: Ceremonial Mace of Malachite
text: Though he cannot swing it as before, the mace's magical power remains just as useful to Lord Kroak now, negating any magical hand-weapon used against him.

name: Mechanical Arm
text: A suddenly-revealed mechanical limb is quite the party trick, but can also quickly turn the tables in a fight.

name: Retractable Fistblade
text: This fistblade attachment has an integrated poisoned-wind injector which, upon laceration, will cause toxic death.

name: Storm Daemon
text: A Warpstone-powered device, created by the Warlock Engineers, that crackles with barely-contained power.

name: Blade of the Ancient Skies
text: Carved from the dense, fossilised jawbone of a monstrous, sky-borne predator that became extinct during ages long past.

name: Thing Zapper
text: This double-handed polearm is more of a torture device than a weapon, used to trap victims by the neck before causing Warp-charged injury.

name: Chameleon Spotter
text: The best scout is always the one the enemy stand no chance of spotting.

name: Consul of Calith
text: This Skink emissary once helped to defeat the Skaven at Calith, the warmbloods’ most important far eastern trading port.

name: Lotl-Botl's Spawn-Brother
text: The Saurus spawned alongside the legendary deliverer of Ruby Sanctum share his prodigious constitution and aptitude for beating the odds.

name: Obsinite Miner Skink
text: Due to obsinite’s widespread use amongst the Lizardmen, those who know the complicated processes of mining it are highly-prized individuals.

name: Piqipoqi & Qupacoco
text: This pair are the notorious kleptomaniac Skink Officers of Hexoatl – the stealers of "that which has been stolen"… and more!

name: Priest of the Star Chambers
text: Only the most distinguished priests attend to the meditating Slann in their Star Chambers, perhaps the greatest responsibility any Skink may bear.

name: Prophet's Spawn-Brother
text: A Red Crested Skink who claims to have spawned from the same pool as the Prophet himself, an assertion accepted by his apostles.

name: Swamp Trawler Skink
text: "The Old Ones gifted me knowledge of Lustria’s many stinking mires so that they may sustain us with their nutritious flora and fauna."

name: Coatlpelt Flagstaff
text: The dragon-headed, snake-like creatures known as Coatls are powerful manipulators of the Winds and often have enchanted pelts.

name: Culchan-Feathered Standard
text: This flightless nomadic bird of the Culchan Plains is an ancient Lizardman totem of migration and the spirit of the march.

name: Exalted Banner of Xapati
text: As inscrutable as any of the Old Ones, Xapati is thought to represent the strength provided by the jungle, and carried onto the battlefield.

name: Flag of the Daystar
text: Emblazoned with gold-threaded iconography, the Daystar is a reminder of Slann resilience during the battles of the Great Catastrophe.

name: Shroud of Chaqua
text: This sacred veil was draped over the rheumy, pus-weeping face of the last Mage-Priest of Chaqua struck down by the Skaven plague.

name: Sign of the Coiled One
text: The Serpent-God is the embodiment of his followers' righteous anger, who use his potent symbol to imbue themselves with strength.

name: Totem of the Spitting Viper
text: A gleaming serpent-form of the sacred spitting viper intensifies the cohorts’ volleys of javelins and darts clouding the battlefield.

name: Totem Pole of Destiny
text: The Lizardmen's notion of fate is understood in terms of instruction, direction, and action expounded by the cohort leaders.

name: Amplifier
text: The power to alter the Winds of Magic with little more than a wave of the hand. Impressive.

name: Obsinite Plate
text: The highest standard of protection... whilst also looking pretty good next to one's peers!

name: The Shield of Aeons
text: Cut from the impossibly dense volcanic rock of the Fire Islands, this massive artefact took generations of Skink artisans to complete.

name: Golden Tributes
text: Every trinket adorning the Wanderer’s massive, battle-scarred body is a testament to the countless battles that he has fought.

name: Shard of the Monolith
text: The shard is ominous yet unknowable, and possessed of an immense power.

name: Key to the Stadsraad
text: Symbolically, the stadtholder holds both the key to Marienburg's parliament buildings and, not so symbolically, the real levers of power in the province.

name: Stahlberg's Letter
text: The ill-fated Witch Hunter Gunther Stahlberg managed to write of his final encounter before Mannfred von Carstein's icy talons clawed him to a horrible death.

name: Amber Bow
text: Carved from Drakwald Oak and enchanted by a powerful Amber Wizard, its shots are guided directly into the hearts of Wulfhart's enemies.

name: Mace of Ulumak
text: It is believed that the Old Ones themselves guide the hand of he who wields the Mace of Ulumak.

name: Mothers' Ruin
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, this much-folded blade has caused many a mother's son to meet his maker somewhat earlier than planned.

name: Beast Slayer
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Beast Slayer' has taken down many of the hideous monsters infesting the dark, dense Drakwald Forest.

name: Goblin Bane
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Goblin Bane', as its name suggests, has cleared the insidious Greenskins from Hochland's vast tracts of wilderness.

name: Legbiter
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Legbiter', like the White Wolf it represents, is the bane of Middenland's many Beastmen and other dangerous predators.

name: Crow Feeder
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Crow Feeder' leaves its prey - often the marauding Norscans - as nothing but so much carrion.

name: Troll Cleaver
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Troll Cleaver' is used to cull the myriad dangerous creatures rampaging around the extremely fertile 'East March'.

name: Brain Wounder
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Brain Wounder' sees almost constant action against the savage Chaos Warbands invading from the desolate, frozen north.

name: Dragon Tooth
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Dragon Tooth' has long defended the Imperial heartlands and capital, Altdorf, from all manner of ill-intentioned foes.

name: Grudge Settler
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Klingerach', also called 'Grudge Settler', has been entrusted to the Reiksmarshal to wield on the Emperor's behalf.

name: Orc Hewer
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, perfect for skewering the foul tide of Greenskins which dares to ravage poor, rural Stirland's rugged uplands.

name: Stone Breaker
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, Talabecland's 'Stone Breaker' has protected the founding province's thriving commerce from bandits of all kinds for centuries.

name: Blood Bringer
text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Blood Bringer' is a mighty blade befitting Wissenland's important status as the centre of Imperial arms production.

name: Scar
text: Assuming you survive the blow, you'll always remember this aptly-named blade.

name: The Ogham Shard
text: The shard is a fractured piece of one of the original Ogham Waystones, whose mystical properties may keep Chaos at bay.

name: The Cloak of Shadows
text: Woven from stolen human hair and spider silk, the cloak both conceals and silences the wearer, making Snikch near invisible in darkness.

name: Jean Claude Sartre's Banner
text: The Banner of Jean Claude Sartre empowers our bowmen to strike fast and true, without hesitation or fear.

name: Pierre d'Arden's Banner
text: The Banner of Pierre d'Arden channels the celebrated Knight of the Realm's vigour and determination into any who bear it.

name: Rene de Cartes' Banner
text: The Banner of Rene de Cartes empowers our spearmen, giving them the strength to hold fast in battle, no matter the danger.

name: Fleur de Lys Banner
text: A symbol of ancient, holy significance, the magical lily only grows where the Lady appears, and is carried to war as sign of Her warriors' devotion.

name: Octagonal Medallion
text: This brass medallion, covered in runes, has the power to dampen the potency of the Winds of Magic.

name: Warp-Gem
text: Just like Elgol's Warp-Gem, this lesser version gives the wielder limited control over the unpredictable Winds of Magic.

name: Arleth Vann
text: The deadly Khainite Assassin Arleth Vann may look underfed, with the drawn look of a wolf, but he is probably the closest thing to a loyal companion that Malus possesses.

name: Balneth Bale
text: The ruthless commander of the Black Ark of Naggor is also Malus' uncle on his mother's side.

name: Bruglir
text: Malus' eldest brother, a renowned captain and Corsair in his own right, is conducting an incestuous relationship with his own sister, Yasmir.

name: Eldire
text: Despite being a Druchii of pure, noble blood – with all the vicious tendencies that entails – and a powerful Sorceress, Eldire still displays a strong maternal instinct towards her broken, possessed son.

name: Engvin
text: Engvin was the first Dark Elf to come into contact with Malus following his possession by Tz'arkan. Amazingly, he survived the experience and escorted the possessed Darkblade back to Hag Graef.

name: Spirit of Hathan Gul
text: In a failed assassination attempt, Hathan Gul was the captain of the Manticore tasked with killing Malus on his father Lurhan's orders.

name: Hauclir
text: For a Dark Elf, Hauclir is surprisingly relaxed and friendly, and as such has developed a genuine bond with Malus.

name: Isilvar
text: Malus next eldest brother is Isilvar, whose unusually-fleshy countenance reveals, to those who know of such things, his secret devotion to Slaanesh...

name: Spirit of Lhunara
text: Though she remains the nearest Malus has ever come to a true love, Lhunara died by his hand, and having pledged devotion to Chaos, was resurrected by the Ruinous Powers that she might take her revenge.

name: Spirit of Lurhan
text: Though he will kill on the spot anyone who brings up the matter, Darkblade was in fact born a bastard – his father being Lurhan Fellblade, the fearsome, undefeated Vaulkhar of Hag Graef.

name: Nagaira
text: Malus' sister is an immensely powerful Sorceress in league with the Chaos Gods, whose goals and motives are perfectly aligned with those of the Ruinous Powers whom she serves.

name: Silar
text: Malus' captain of guards is as close as a Dark Elf can possibly get to being honourable and dutiful, and so remains one of an extremely small group whom the tyrant feels he can trust.

name: Urial
text: Malus' half-brother may well be crippled, and as such should have been forsaken to die, but he remains a Chosen of Khaine and a priest of the Murder-God.

name: Yasmir
text: Malus' sister is one of the most beautiful women in Hag Graef. Though she herself keeps many lovers, she is – somewhat hypocritically – furiously jealous of them all.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.

name: Hippogryph
text: Taming a mighty Hippogryph presents a challenge that many Bretonnian lords cannot turn down.

name: Suleman
text: Commandeered as a rider-less warhorse of a slain Knight, Suleman boldly charges Repanse into battle at the apex of her feared lance formation.

name: Manticore
text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

name: Scourgerunner Chariot
text: Dark Elf Beastmasters roam the wilds atop their dreaded chariots, armed with barbed nets and harpoons to slay the foe and ensnare their prey.

name: Spite
text: Larger than most others of its kind, the ferocious Cold One named 'Spite' is truly a creature fit for a heartless murderer like Malus Darkblade.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Cold One Chariot
text: Magnificent chariots, gifted to those who have impressed with their devotion, bravery and prowess in battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Amulet of Defiance
text: Just like the Amulet of Vaurog, used by a Chaos Champion to survive his duel with Malus, this enchanted piece makes the wielder almost invulnerable to wounding by a lesser weapon.

name: Idol of Darkness
text: Although not as powerful as the fabled Idol of Kolkuth, this lesser piece still gives the wielder control over the fabrics of time, though for a limited time only.

name: The Warpsword of Blood
text: This lesser, but by no means less deadly, Warpsword hungers for blood and yearns to gorge itself upon bested flesh.

name: The Dagger of Souls
text: Like the Dagger of Torxus, this blade is similar in that it can weaken and wound even the strongest of creatures in single combat.

name: The Warpsword of Death
text: Though it may be less powerful than the Warpsword of Khaine, this enchanted blade hungers for death itself – a ravenous urge that can never be fully sated!

name: The Warpsword of Slaughter
text: This dread blade, though lesser in power and stature than the Warpsword of Khaine, revels in the endless slaughter it unleashes upon the battlefield.

name: The Sword of Lyonesse
text: When first she faced Chaos, Repanse broke open the reliquary of the village Grail Chapel and took up the ancient sword she found there.

name: The Warpsword of Khaine
text: "The Time of Blood is at hand!"

name: Whirl of Weeping Blades
text: With a poisoned sword in both hands and his own tail, few warriors can survive long against the Deathmaster.

name: Blackened Staff
text: It seems this mysterious staff has not only survived Shackolot's scorching breath, but also absorbed some strange magic as a result.

name: Blacktoof's Head in a Jar
text: Power-saturated and incredibly annoying, Blacktoof’s blabbering head enables frightening manifestations when in the hands of a spellcaster. Time will tell whether his words will lead Grom to his ultimate prize or are simply the ramblings of a lunatic.

name: Armour of Caledor
text: Donned by the masters of the House of Caledor, this ensorcelled armour has endured over four thousand years of battles.

name: Vine Dragon Scale
text: Shed from the Forest Dragon Bruwor himself, this Draconic scale has sentient vines that reach out like tentacles to ensnare nearby enemies.

name: Helm of Yvresse
text: The ceremonial crown of he who protects Yvresse’s ancient metropolis is an inspirational symbol of dogged determination.

name: Lucky Banner
text: Along with his serendipitous standard-bearer, Niblet, who once somehow survived being sat on by him, the Goblin King’s banner brings inexplicable luck.

name: Shooting Star
text: Said to have fallen from the stars, the otherworldly origins of this artefact are a mystery, but Ymwrath frequents such realms.

name: Sir Man Delour
text: A strange knight who claims he hails from Pigbarter. He appears to be writing a treatise on the relative merits of entertainment available across the old world.

name: Old Blacktoof head - shouldn't appear in new campaigns
text: OLD VERSION - DELETE WHEN POSSIBLE

name: White Lion Chariot
text: Those who employ War Lion Chariots benefit considerably from the ferocity of the huge, snarling cats, keeping foes exposed to their cleaving weaponry.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Moon Dragon
text: Those atop the mighty Moon Drakes are steeled in the knowledge of their mount’s enlightened strength that has seen them face down Daemons.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Moon Dragon
text: Those atop the mighty Moon Drakes are steeled in the knowledge of their mount’s enlightened strength that has seen them face down Daemons.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Stormwing
text: Together with Stormwing, Eltharion cuts through Ulthuan’s foes like a wind of blades as the mighty Griffon rakes and claws with savagery.

name: Minaithnir
text: Imrik’s fanatically loyal Drake is a symbol of the Elf Lord’s irrefutable eminence as the last true Dragon Prince.

name: Mautererius
text: The Dragon Prince’s unwavering steed is bedecked in plates and scales of ‘sky-silver’ that mimic the appearance of a mighty Drake.

name: Sun Dragon
text: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

name: Griffon
text: The wild Griffons of Ulthuan are creatures of noble bearing and keen intelligence, with whom Elves form bonds that only death can shatter.

name: Griffon
text: The wild Griffons of Ulthuan are creatures of noble bearing and keen intelligence, with whom Elves form bonds that only death can shatter.

name: Arcane Phoenix
text: Fighting upon an Arcane Phoenix, Teclis rides the magical tempests, harnessing the power of the howling Winds sweeping through the world of mortals.

name: Sun Shard
text: Even the smallest essence of the sun’s power is potent enough to push away the darkness and bring forth the light.

name: Talisman of Hoeth
text: This finely wrought medallion allows its wearer a measure of the original Warden's magical knowledge to aid in the guardianship of Yvresse.

name: Axe of Grom
text: Like a butcher’s cleaver, Grom uses the fabled ‘Elf-Biter’ to make tasty cuts of meat out of his rivals!

name: Fangsword of Eltharion
text: This rune-encrusted longsword has been passed down through Eltharion’s family for generations, bestowing unto him the zeal of his forefathers.

name: Moon-Touched Spear
text: The powerful touch of the Moon Dragon Lamoureux has enchanted this spear, enabling it to overcome even the most hot-blooded of enemies.

name: Star Lance
text: Legend has it that the Star Lance strikes with the wrath of a Star Dragon, and cannot be unmade while the Drakes still live upon Ulthuan.

name: Wand of Wych Elm
text: This twisted and gnarled staff is cut from the rare and magical Wych Elm tree that draws magic from the ground beneath.

name: Dragon Cuirass
text: Solid and resplendent, the Dragon scales strewn across the surface of this corselet reveal the nature of its imperishability.

name: Refined Dragon Cuirass
text: Solid and resplendent, the Dragon scales strewn across the surface of this corselet reveal the nature of its imperishability.

text: Solid and resplendent, the Dragon scales strewn across the surface of this corselet reveal the nature of its imperishability.

name: Reforged Dragon Cuirass
text: Solid and resplendent, the Dragon scales strewn across the surface of this corselet reveal the nature of its imperishability.

name: Dreaming Boots
text: These boots also exist in dimensions other than the physical, slightly distorting the flow of time and enabling their wearer to cover much ground.

name: Refined Dreaming Boots

name: Eagle Vambraces
text: These feather-laden vambraces may appear lightweight, but their impenetrable plumes were gifted to Lord Daith by an aerie of Albion Great Eagles.

name: Great Stag Helm
text: The noble Great Stag is a revered creature of Athel Loren; if one should die, wearing a helm fashioned from its antlers honours its spirit.

name: Heartstone of Athel Loren
text: Focusing upon this ancient gem can help to calm its bearer's inner thoughts and concentrate resilience when the Winds are used against them.

name: Twilight Helm
text: The inspirational magic of this helm can make a good leader into a great one, and a great leader into a legend.

name: Refined Twilight Helm
text: The inspirational magic of this helm can make a good leader into a great one, and a great leader into a legend.

name: Acorns of the Oak of Ages
text: Concentrated within a single acorn of the Mighty Oak is the potential for an instant and devastating release of explosive magical power.

name: Ceithin-Har's Scale
text: A single scale of Ceithin-Har’s near impervious hide symbolises the forest’s will to survive and repel that which seeks to cause it harm.

name: Dragon Pendant
text: The jewel at the centre of this pendant shimmers with preternatural lifeforce, for it is said that a sky wyrm’s soul is contained within.

name: Dreaming Cloak
text: Whoever dons this cloak does not just become one with the forest, but one with the hardened sentinels who guard Athel Caiellin’s fluctuating portals.

name: Eagle Quiver
text: At opportune moments, an arrow pulled from this enchanted quiver is willed by Talyn's spirit to fly truer towards cruel hearts.

name: Fang of Taalroth
text: Many in the realms of men believe this powerful dampener of magic was once carried by their God of Nature, Taal himself.

name: Twilight Standard
text: It matters not who holds this banner aloft, Ariel’s enchanted blazonry inspires and empowers all who march to war for the forest.

name: Whip of Domination
text: Even the hunchbacked and mutated things of Hell Pit’s warrens can be frenzied forward by the stinging pain of Throt’s scathing minotaur-hide whip.

name: Bonebreaker
text: A specially-engineered breed of Rat Ogre, the Bonebreaker has a braced platform strapped or bolted to its back for carrying a Skaven Warlord to battle.

name: Brood Horror
text: For the gaudier Warlord, Clan Moulder offers their most bloated Pox Rats as mounts to flail, crush, and savage a way through the enemy’s ranks.

name: Brood Horror

name: Great Stag
text: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

name: Great Stag
text: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

name: Ceithin-Har
text: Forest Dragons are not known for their recklessness, but the venturesome Ceithin-Har is a true reflection of the Sisters’ combative aspect.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellweaver where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Twilight Horn
text: No purer sound is there than a single note from this great horn, capable of emboldening the faint of heart and rousing the timid.

name: Creature-Killer
text: Throt’s modified things-catcher makes him an expert throttler, but allows him to excel at throttling things much larger than man-sized!

name: Dart of Doom
text: This thorn-tipped dart carved directly from the Tree of Woe is magically engraved to cripple weapons and deliver painful injury.

name: Dragon Spear
text: A sharpened claw at this spear’s tip is impelled by the rage of the ancient Forest Dragon to whom it once belonged.

name: Dreaming Bow
text: Though it appears gnarled and twisted, this longbow’s appearance belies the uncanny distance its arrows can fly.

name: Eagle Bow
text: This weapon’s strange, ethereal carvings betoken a power that can grant instinctive awareness of the lay of the land of a battlefield.

name: Twilight Spear
text: Crafted for the hands of a true leader, the shimmer of this spear’s point bolsters the zeal of all who are led to battle.

name: Refined Twilight Spear
text: Crafted for the hands of a true leader, the shimmer of this spear’s point bolsters the zeal of all who are led to battle.

text: Crafted for the hands of a true leader, the shimmer of this spear’s point bolsters the zeal of all who are led to battle.

name: Witstealer Sword
text: The Witstealer Sword was forged in the molten heat of desire and cooled in a vat of Slaanesh's blood.

name: Cloak of Unreality
text: This matted pelt of an old and powerful Great Bray-Shaman still warps reality long after its owner’s death.

name: Mutated Ghorgon Hide
text: The clawing hunger of the flayed bloodbrute remains, driving the wearer into a bloodthirsty frenzy.

name: Thorek's Rune Armour
text: Thorek’s self-crafted armour can turn a Giant’s club, allowing the Runelord to walk unscathed through the flames of the Wyrm Drakamol.

name: Banner of Madness
text: Held aloft, the voluminous, scathing hide of the Jabberslythe, purposed into a war standard, can induce madness within foes.

name: Banner of Unholy Exultation
text: This once-glorious war banner was stolen and soiled with fell designs to drive the herd to greater feats.

name: Banner of Ghorok
text: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible but dangerous to the bearer.

name: Daemonbane
text: The ground crystals of Tzeentch's realm can imbue darts with the power to pierce any ward and find the weakest points on the most formidable foes.

name: Fireblood Toxin
text: Imbued with a Bloodthirster's crushed horn, the already-explosive blood of a Fireleech gains horrifying sentience, clinging to armour until it burns the flesh beneath.

name: Slow Death
text: Harvested from a rare flower found only in the most toxic corners of Nurgle's gardens, this poison ensures a long and painful death.

name: Toadskin Essence
text: Slaaneshi daemons are masters of illusion – a combination of their blood with the toxins of rare toads produces a debilitating hallucinogen.

name: Blessing of Filth
text: This blessing manifests in horrific boils, undulating flesh and a terrible growth that renders the Beastmen near impossible to keep down.

name: Blessing of Mania
text: This blessing drives the Beastmen into a self-destructive mania, their desire for flesh so great that they must feast lest they dine upon themselves!

name: Blessing of Trickery
text: This blessing boils the very eyes of the Beastmen, creating great undulating clouds of steam that both obscures them and tears metal to shreds.

name: Fimir Linebreakers
text: These Fimir are devoted to the Troll King, taking up an unstoppable hammer formation to break open his foes.

name: Skin Wolf Stalkers
text: The unending hunger of the Skin Wolves need not be a curse, but a tool precisely applied where the Troll King decrees.

name: Troll Guardians
text: Uncannily cogent for Trolls, the Troll King's devoted form a bulwark around their king that breaks the charges of foolish cavalry.

name: Blind Eye of Seeing
text: It is a cruel twist of fate that those cursed with blindness can truly see the madness-inducing Winds of the wild.

name: Kraggi, Assistant at the Forge
text: When Thorek’s long-suffering assistant pays sufficient attention to his master’s gruff commands, few can match the Master Runelord’s prowess on the Anvil of Doom.

name: Tuskgor Chariot
text: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.
