name: Anvil of Doom
text: Covered in the Runelord’s ancient script, the anvil has given form to the most powerful runic weapons ever forged.

name: Barded Skeletal Steed
text: A Wight King was once a Chieftain or a warrior-king of his tribe and so may have been buried with a loyal steed that still wears its rusted barding.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: The Wight King calls forth a spectral steed of bone to ride upon, should he have favoured it during his once-lived life.

name: Flakkson's Rune of Seeking
text: With this rune, artillery fires with a devastating range once used to shoot Dragons Riders from the sky.

name: Master Rune of Disguise
text: The magic of this rune distorts the air around Dwarfen war machines, hiding them from the enemy's view.

name: Master Rune of Immolation
text: This rune ensures the prized war machines of the Dwarfs will never fall into enemy hands.

name: Rune of Burning
text: War machines bearing this rune will rain fire down on the enemy, setting them ablaze with volatile flame.

name: Rune of Penetration
text: Artillery soars from the war machines bearing this rune, piercing through armour into tender, vulnerable flesh.

name: Ancestor Rune of Grimnir
text: Grimnir's rune calls on the power of the Ancestor himself, smiting foes with heavy molten rock.

name: Ancestor Rune of Grungni
text: The natural strength of the Dwarfs is imbued in this rune, amplifying their power in battle.

name: Ancestor Rune of Valaya
text: The blessing of Valaya is bestowed by this rune, mending broken bones and knitting the rended flesh of wearied warriors.

name: Master Rune of Alaric the Mad
text: The Master Rune of Alaric the Mad augments every cut and thrust of the weapon it adorns.

name: Master Rune of Adamant
text: The bearer of this rune will stand as an impenetrable wall of steel, unflinching in the face of injury.

name: Master Rune of Flight
text: Few foes can withstand the impact of a thrown hammer, nor conquer their fear when the hammer magically returns to its bearer.

name: Master Rune of Gromril
text: This rune grants the protective embrace of the toughest metal in the known world.

name: Master Rune of Passage
text: Through dense vegetation and rugged terrain, this rune clears the way with ease.

name: Master Rune of Skalf Blackhammer
text: Like the hammers forged by the Runesmith Skalf, any weapon bearing this rune will deal catastrophic damage with every strike.

name: Master Rune of Snorri Spangelhelm
text: As Runesmith to the High King, Snorri knew well that no weapon is as dependable as a weapon that strikes true.

name: Master Rune of Spite
text: First embedded in the gates of Karaz-a-Karak, the damaging aura permeating from this rune is enough to turn most enemies away.

name: Rune of Cleaving
text: This rune was originally designed for Dwarfen Miners, allowing them to cleave through even the hardest rock.

name: Rune of Fear
text: An aura of almighty power stems from this rune, causing all foes nearby to tremble with terror.

name: Rune of Fire
text: An unbearable heat radiates from this rune, making each attack from its bearer strike with searing flame.

name: Rune of Impact
text: With this rune struck onto a warrior's armour, none could stand against the thunderous impact of their charge.

name: Rune of Iron
text: The magic of this rune weaves over itself in protective layers, increasing its potency and shielding its wearer from harm.

name: Rune of Luck
text: When the odds are stacked in the enemies' favour, it helps to have luck on one's side.

name: Rune of Shielding
text: First struck during the War of Vengeance, a shield bearing this rune would protect against the most relentless of missile fire.

name: Champion's Essence
text: All that remains of this lost champion of the herd is the essence of their savage and proud soul.

name: Shardstone Amulet
text: The Shard of a mighty Herdstone drives weak minds to distraction.

name: Fell-Axe of the Drakwald
text: Following the slaughter of the Faulk-men, this weapon was infused with fell powers.

name: Klad Brakak
text: The runic energy within Thorek's mighty hammer builds and crackles, erupting in an earth-shattering thunderbolt.

name: Rune-Tortured Axes
text: The Brass Bull wields his rune-inscribed axes with savage pride, constantly clashing them together in the rare moments between his rampages.

name: The Golden Blowpipe of P'Toohee
text: With just the lightest exhalation, this golden instrument of death blasts forth a hail of murderous darts.

name: Battle-Scarred Ungor Raider
text: With unsurpassed knowledge, these no-horns know the ways to bring death to those who think themselves safe.

name: Cupped Hands of the Old Ones
text: A sphere of glowing light extends around the bearer as the divine protection of the Old Ones deflects the uncontrolled maelstrom of magic.

name: Diadem of Power
text: This circlet is inscribed with arcane glyphs and symbols, allowing the spellcaster to perceive and manipulate the Winds of Magic.

name: Itxi Grubs
text: The Wizard carries a gourd containing dried grubs; when he eats them, he gains the energy the grubs have absorbed.

name: Jewel of the Dusk
text: This fine ruby glows blood-red with a sorcerous energy that even the least magically adept can clearly see.

name: Moon Staff of Lileath
text: The Moon Staff is imbued with the immortal power of the Goddess Lileath, eternally youthful daughter of Isha.

name: Staff of Solidity
text: Those that bear the staff gain the discipline of the Asur.

name: Wand of the Kharaidon
text: A powerful item of dark sorcery, this wand unleashes the power of the fell Daemon Kharaidon on command.

name: War Crown of Saphery
text: Seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower, the War Crown was given to Teclis by the former High Loremaster and holds great power.

name: Warp-Energy Condenser
text: A rune-inscribed power pack covered in fly wheels, copper coil and enchanted mechanisms to draw energy from the fickle Winds of Magic.

name: Warpstone Tokens
text: Pieces of refined Warpstone that can be eaten to aid in spellcasting, also used as currency within the Under-Empire.

name: Dragonscale Mail
text: When a Noble of Caledor dons this ornate, ancient armour, his resolve and fortune are redoubled.

name: Armour of Darkness
text: Forged from meteoric steel, this suit is all but impossible to dent or pierce.

name: Armour of Living Death
text: It is claimed that anyone wearing this armour cannot die. Unfortunately, they cannot remove it either and will be slowly driven insane.

name: Armour of Midnight
text: Malekith's rune-armour is forged from the hardest meteoric iron and protects against any mortal weapon.

name: Boots of Braccus
text: These splendid armoured boots are encrusted with bone fragments belonging to a legendary steed.

name: Chromatic Armour
text: This chainmail is exceptionally shiny; that's impressive, considering it's Skaven-made!

name: Cloak of Hag Graef
text: Made from the scales of Aggraunir, the first sea Dragon captured, the cloak can withstand the harshest blows.

name: Crown of Authority
text: A grand helm of Elven origin, whose wearer is held in awe.

name: Dragon Armour of Aenarion
text: Forged in Vaul's Anvil, worn by Aenarion until his death, and only a few of Ulthuan's gloried heroes since.

name: Dragonscale Shield
text: Although battered and scarred, the shield is a treasured heirloom from the days Dragons freely roamed the skies.

name: Enchanted Ithilmar Breastplate
text: Ithilmar is the star-metal of the Elves, fashioned in an ornate breastplate and then enchanted with wards.

name: Helm of Fortune
text: A helm of ithilmar and sea gold, bordered with intertwining runic script that form a prayer to invoke Asuryan's protection.

name: Helm of Khaine
text: An ornate helm of black steel that contains the tiniest fragments of Khaine's never-ending wrath.

name: Hide of the Cold Ones
text: The wearer's appearance is fearsome to behold. However, the hide exudes a toxic slime that slowly poisons them and dulls their mind.

name: Lion's Pelt
text: A pelt of pure white fur blessed by the Everqueen and harvested by the great Elven hero, Alastar the Hunter.

name: Rocket Boots
text: While these Skryre-crafted boots cannot lift the wearer off the ground, they surely make him fleeter of foot!

name: Sacred Stegadon Helm of Itza
text: One that wears the helm is accorded the reverence due of a Slann, for it is a mighty symbol of power.

name: Shadow Armour
text: This shimmering armour weighs almost nothing and exists somewhere between the real and shadow worlds.

name: Shield of the Merwyrm
text: A single scale from the mighty Amanar, the protector of Lothern.

name: Shield of the Mirrored Pool
text: The face of the shield is dark and reflective; ripples spread from its centre when it deflects blows.

name: Shroud of Death
text: The tormented soul of an assassin is eternally bound to this cold shroud.

name: Skull Helmet
text: A truly dreadful helmet, adorned as it is with the skulls of children.

name: The Maiming Shield
text: The shield is a more a weapon than for protection, its bearer able to hack and slash with the barbed edges.

name: Winged Boots
text: Such boots grant the wearer a boost of speed; companions tacitly ignore the little wings on the sides.

name: Enriched Warpstone Dust
text: This highly-mutagenic powder causes glorious visions of decay in those who inhale it.

name: Box of Eerie Noises
text: What is in the box? No-one knows, but the sounds it produces makes even the bravest flee in mortal terror!

name: Brass Horn
text: Grim resolve fills the heart of those that hear this clarion.

name: Chest of Sustenance
text: This wooden and bone chest contains great bounty.

name: Cloak of Beards
text: The Asur take beards from defeated Dwarfs. The hair has been woven into a cloak guaranteed to enrage any Dwarf that sees it.

name: Cloak of Twilight
text: Woven from the hair of innocents, and dyed with the blood of Sorcerers, it is all but invisible to the mortal eye.

name: Divine Plaque of Protection
text: The Shield of the Old Ones grows more powerful under the influence of this glowing plaque.

name: Dragonfly of Quicksilver
text: Crafted under the guidance of Tepok, this small metal dragonfly can fly around a battlefield giving crucial knowledge to its owner.

name: Folariath's Robe
text: An ancient vestment enchanted by the eccentric Mage, Folariath.

name: Khaine's Ring of Fury
text: The most feared of all Elven magical rings is the black iron Ring of Fury, belonging to Khaine, the Bloody-handed God of Murder.

name: Moranion's Wayshard
text: Few could tread the fog-wreathed paths so surely as he, for he bore a wayshard attuned to the great watchstone at the realm's heart.

name: Odd Powder Keg
text: This keg is filled with Dwarfen gunpowder mixed with Warpstone and other volatile substances. Stand well back… and don't sneeze!

name: Ring of Hukon
text: A ring of a wrathful god will make its bearer faster, and more aggressive in his outlook.

name: Rod of Briars
text: With just a casual flick of the wrist, spiteful vines spring up and lash out at the foe.

name: Satchel of Potions
text: "Try this, it was distilled from the blood of a famous Asur alchemist!"

name: The Cloak of Feathers
text: The cloak is made from the feathers of the mysterious Coatl, shimmering with a power to ward against dark sorcery.

name: Venom of the Firefly Frog
text: Extracted from the glands of the deadly firefly frog, it can cause a fatal wound with even the tiniest scratch.

name: Assassin's Apprentice
text: An assassin's services will always be in demand, assuming they survive the training…

name: Wyrmhunter
text: Anath Raema's savage children can break enemy lines with tooth and claw. This one ensures their obedience in battle.

name: Bodyguard
text: There are always those in need of protection from the machinations of their enemies… or indeed their friends.

name: Pleasure Cultist
text: The favour of the Pleasure Prince is much coveted amongst his acolytes.

name: Daemon Whisperer
text: "What's that? Pleasure and pain… indivisible? I see the truth of it..."

name: Envoy
text: It is sometimes necessary to employ silver-tongued diplomacy to achieve one's desired ends.

name: Dark Prince's Envoy
text: Slaanesh offers great power to those who have the resolve to grasp it.

name: Zealot
text: This one lives for the day when the last High-Elf dies screaming in agony upon Khaine's altar.

name: Fimir Balefiend
text: The Balefiend's sorceries may seem crude and ritualistic compared to others, but they are no less potent.

name: Gravedigger
text: Nothing reinforces a Dark Elf's sense of superiority (and security) quite so much as knowing not only that his enemy has perished, but also where the body is buried.

name: Eunuch
text: You should never trust a wolf with your livestock.

name: Harem Keeper
text: "What's your pleasure, sir?"

name: Factor
text: When your rulers consider themselves above such low professions, there is money to be made for the wily merchant.

name: Evil Choirmaster
text: "The adagio will, quite literally, tear your heart out…"

name: Degenerate Kettle Drummer
text: Cruelty and excess have a certain rhythm.

name: Deviant Flautist
text: Depravity's melody is the sweetest of tunes to Dark Elf ears.

name: Organ Merchant
text: The profits of murder go beyond merely removing one's rivals from the field of play.

name: Overseer
text: Someone needs to ensure that enslaved captives do not - cannot - run away, and occasionally feed them just enough to remain productive.

name: Rhetorician
text: When the deeds of old can be erased by a cleverly-spoken word, what need is there for integrity and law?

name: Elfservant
text: "He's the very likeness of Khaine himself! I should know - slaving and doing for him all these years."

name: High Elf Slave
text: Beaten by lash and scourge, brutally driven forth into servitude and torment. There is no release, not even death.

name: Slaver
text: A captured High Elf is the most valuable of prizes; a wealthy slaver will trade much to bring such a sweetmeat before his patron.

name: Herald of Mathlann
text: An Elf whose time at sea exceeds that on land is well versed in the Storm-God's ways, and knows his will.

name: Court Attendant
text: So stealthy is the wolf that the sheep do not notice his presence until it is far, far too late.

name: Bard
text: The history of the High Elves of Ulthuan, handily converted to rhyming couplets for ease of consumption.

name: Beard Weaver
text: Someone has to ensure that the Cloak of Beards is maintained, lest its power over Dwarfen runes slacken.

name: Advisor to the King
text: "I feel it would be prudent, your majesty, and admirably demonstrate your divine wisdom to all."

name: Druchii Hunter
text: The agents of Hoeth seek out those Dark Elves who dare infiltrate Asur society.

name: Dragon Armourer
text: His wares are forged at the volcano's molten heart, and enchanted to resist almost any blow.

name: Caledorian Dragon Rouser
text: Like his illustrious ancestor, this one can wake mighty Dragons and bind them to his will with harnesses of truesteel.

name: Food Taster
text: Unless the poison is slow-acting, his employer's life will be preserved by the forfeit of his own; according to Asuryan's will.

name: Ellyrian Horsemaster
text: Ellyrion's horses are not broken with harsh treatment. Instead, the enchanted beasts serve willingly when called.

name: Sapherian Bibliothecary
text: The greatest repository of magical knowledge in the world is maintained by the finest mages and scholars.

name: Minstrel
text: "I sing in praise of Total War…"

name: Herbalist
text: Joranor's in the lower vault, mixing up the medicine.

name: Priest of Vaul
text: "Like the Maker, we labour eternally in readiness for the great darkness that surely comes to consume the world."

name: Priestess of Isha
text: Their origins shrouded in the mists of time, Isha's priestesses officiate her mysterious rites on the Island of Rebirth.

name: Raven Keeper
text: A relationship with the Crone protects one from harm and can even forestall the seemingly inevitable.

name: Chracian Scout
text: He watches and waits, constantly alert and ready for Druchii incursions through the passes of his homeland.

name: Shrine Attendant
text: "Silence, please, when entering the sacred space. And take off your shoes."

name: Disciple of the Phoenix
text: This one aspires to mastery of fire magic, so it may be harnessed at will.

name: Eatainean Vintner
text: "I want the finest wines available to the Asur! I want them here and I want them now!"

name: Acolyte Mage
text: It takes many long years of study and observance to become a fully-fledged Skink Priest.

name: Temple Architect
text: This one toils ceaselessly to restore the great temple-cities to their former glory.

name: Great Plan Archivist
text: "Yesss - this latest scheme is in keeping with the Great Plan; the Old Ones will be pleased."

name: Prize Hunter
text: With the best will in the Old World, something capable of uprooting trees can be rather tricky to harness.

name: Artefact Hunter
text: "It is something that other races were not meant to disturb. Death has always surrounded it. It is not of this world."

name: Astromancer
text: "When Morrslieb is in retrograde, that is when we should strike. Never before, lest disaster befalls us."

name: Astronomer
text: He scans the heavens, for the return of the Old Ones comes closer with each passing day.

name: Hibernation Attendant
text: "It isss vital to ensssure the master isss kept cool and moist until his time of waking."

name: Spawning Pool Cleaner
text: A clean pool, free from contamination, is necessary for a successful spawning.

name: Administrator
text: This one ensures that the hosts are well supplied and equipped, so that the wheels of war stay greased always.

name: Great Warder
text: Watchtowers, spiked-pits, sentinels - the defences must be maintained lest the Realm of Chaos breaks through to consume the world.

name: Fan Waver
text: It is important to stay cool in the cloying, oppressive heat of the jungle.

name: Carnivorous Horticulturist
text: Lustria's first line of defence is the forest itself.

name: Sacred Plaque Librarian
text: The sacred plaques carry the instructions and predictions of the Old Ones. It is his job to preserve their wisdom for future generations.

name: Star-Metallurgist
text: The knowledge and skill required to forge portal gates from super-heated star-metal is granted only to the worthy few.

name: Man-Spawn Sacrifice
text: "You are not part of the Great Plan, ssso your meagre life isss forfeit."

name: Rat-Spawn Sacrifice
text: The ancient enemy, virulent and plague-ridden, makes the best sacrifices.

name: Temple Keeper
text: For some, whose lot it is, mastery of the broom comes before mastery of the spear.

name: Scarred One
text: "I was with the Saurus Warriors on the Bridge of Stars, when Lord Kroak's spirit saved the First City…"

name: Zoat Servant
text: When eldritch storms erupt upon the world, it is possible to bind a Zoat to service.

name: Sea Cucumber
text: They say Skaven aren't picky when it comes to food, but even they have limits.

name: Artefact Hunter
text: There are arcane secrets hidden in the vaults beneath the temple-cities of Lustria. Useful secrets, to give advantage.

name: Bell Polisher
text: "Yes, yes! I want it so shiny that you can see your face in it and I can eat a manling off it!"

name: Bodyguard
text: This one has a greater-than-usual care for the person of his foul, pox-ridden master.

name: Alchemist
text: The elite of Skaven society can live for hundreds of years, their spans extended by Warpstone-exposure, foul spells, and strange, powerful potions…

name: Clerk
text: Plots, plans, and intrigue abound inside the Under-Empire, and they must all be recorded lest something vitally important is forgotten.

name: Engineering Student
text: "Not that colour-shade, no-no, scrape-scratch the grime away…"

name: Breeder
text: Only the privileged, high-caste members of Skaven society are permitted a female with which to breed.

name: Hell Pit Attendant
text: Clan Moulder's hideous experiments require a steady supply of unfortunates. This one sees to their 'needs'.

name: Mechanic
text: "I can fix it, guv, yes yes - I'll have it working again in a trice, yes yes!"

name: Messenger
text: "Yes, master, I will tell him what you said and return by nightfall."

name: Pet Wolf Rat
text: Vicious and foul-tempered - the result of a hideous experiment whereby Skaven were crossed with Kislevite Wolves. Very nasty. Best avoid stroking it…

name: Clan Skryre Saboteur
text: Getting to the target is one thing, destroying it without killing yourself is quite another.

name: Beard-Thing Sacrifice
text: One less stunted fool in the war for control of the Under-Empire can't be a bad thing.

name: Reptile-Thing Sacrifice
text: The Great Horned Rat's hunger MUST be appeased, and the ancient enemy make the most-satisfying meals.

name: Scavenger
text: This one probes the manling towns, instigating war between natural allies and turning man against his brother.

name: Scribe
text: The deeds of the mighty Clans, recorded for posterity and handy reference, give direction and purpose to their future endeavours.

name: Warpstone Sculptor
text: The image of the Great Horned One, fashioned from finest Warpstone and adorned with his commandments is a thing of power

name: Man-Thing Slave
text: "They're not usually that colour - if you scrape all the grime away they're a hideous pink…"

name: Elf-Thing Slave
text: The lofty arrogance of the Elfin race, reduced to filthy, subservient wretchedness. It's a beautiful thing.

name: Eshin Apprentice
text: Those who fail to learn fail to live another despicable, worthless second.

name: Banner of Ellyrion
text: This small pennant of Korhandir, the father of all horses, imbues steeds with tireless energy to traverse the densest terrain.

name: Banner of Murder
text: This banner is steeped in the blood of sacrificial victims, its murderous aura instilling a thirst for death and carnage in its bearers.

name: Banner of the Under-Empire
text: Frenzied rats accompany the pack that carries the unholy icon on the Horned Rat and that of the Under-Empire itself.

name: Banner of the World Dragon
text: This magnificent standard is emblazoned with the glittering image of the World Dragon - a symbol of mighty Ulthuan.

name: Banner of Verminous Scurrying
text: Rituals of skittering urgency allow this banner to deliver a surge of energy to the unit carrying it.

name: Dread Banner
text: Such is the supernatural fear instilled by the visage of the Bloody-handed God upon this standard that few dare to even look at it.

name: Dwarf-Hide Banner
text: Such a banner is an affront to the eyes (and noses) of any Dwarf. It is made from Dawi-skin, soaked in Warp-infused urine and decorated with scalped beards.

name: Grand Banner of Clan Superiority
text: This banner is a colossal totem trophy rack. It screams to be looked at, so that other clans might be impressed or cowed.

name: Huanchi's Blessed Totem
text: A portion of the boundless energy of the Old One Huanchi resides in this totem, giving its bearers an unnatural burst of speed.

name: Hydra Banner
text: Imbued with the magic of Hekarti the Hydra Queen, this banner quickens the reflexes so that those nearby strike with her own speed and savagery.

name: Lion Standard
text: An aura of courage fills the hearts of those who serve under this banner, making them each as fierce as a lion!

name: Sacred Banner of the Horned Rat
Shroud of Dripping Death
text: This horrid banner is covered in foul stains that drip and splash as the bearer moves; the whole vile hide throbs, oozing a greenish-tinted fluid.

name: Standard of Hag Graef
text: A banner depicting the dread city. Under the mystical influence of this serpentine banner, warriors strike with astounding speed.

name: Sun Standard of Chotec
text: Beams of intense sunlight streaming from this standard make it all but impossible to look upon. Those who do stare too long will be blinded.

name: The Jaguar Standard
text: The animal spirit of the jaguar is represented with this standard. Those in the shadow of this jungle beast hunt down their enemies with relentless ferocity and persistence.

name: Totem of Prophecy
text: This totem causes those who look upon it to realise their own mortality - the futility of their own small lives within the grand scheme of the Old Ones washes over them.

name: Cauldron of Blood
text: A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.

name: Black Dragon
text: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Black Dragon
text: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus

name: Dark Steed

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Cold One Chariot
text: Magnificent chariots, gifted to those who have impressed with their devotion, bravery and prowess in battle.

name: Seraphon
text: This terrifying Black Dragon is the Witch King's favoured mount upon which to ride into battle.

name: Sulephet
text: The only Dark Pegasus to bear a name is Morathi's personal mount, who carries the Hag Sorceress into the fray.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

name: Dark Pegasus
text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

name: Dark Steed
text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Star Dragon
text: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

name: Sun Dragon
text: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Ithilmar Chariot
text: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Star Dragon
text: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

name: Sun Dragon
text: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

name: Elven Steed
text: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

name: Great Eagle
text: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

name: Moon Dragon
text: Those who ride atop the mighty Moon Drakes are steeled in the knowledge of their mount’s enlightened, Daemon-slaying strength.

name: Star Dragon
text: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
text: An extremely light yet resilient material, ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

name: Malhandhir
text: The finest Ellyrion steed, atop which Tyrion has single-handedly put verminous hordes to flight.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.

name: Grymloq
text: Grymloq is Kroq-Gar's ageless Carnosaur, upon which the great Lizardman Lord has won all his many victories.

name: Horned One
text: Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.

name: Zlaaq
text: The largest Stegadon to be found anywhere, Zlaaq has served Lord Mazdamundi faithfully for almost five hundred years.

name: Carnosaur
text: The ultimate jungle hunters, these large, apex predators have terrorised the primordial jungles since the dawn of existence.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.

name: Carnosaur
text: The ultimate jungle hunters, these large, apex predators have terrorised the primordial jungles since the dawn of existence.

name: Cold One
text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.

name: Ancient Stegadon
text: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

name: Stegadon
text: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Ancient Stegadon
text: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

name: Stegadon
text: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Ancient Stegadon
text: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

name: Stegadon
text: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

name: Terradon
text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

name: Screaming Bell
text: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, its ominous tolling strikes awe into evil Skaven hearts and fear into their opponents.

name: Screaming Bell
text: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, its ominous tolling strikes awe into evil Skaven hearts and fear into their opponents.

name: Plague Furnace
text: This altar, ridden with disease, is a fitting pulpit from which the Plague Priests preach their words of poison and death.

name: Bonebreaker
text: A specially-engineered breed of Rat Ogre, the Bonebreaker has a braced platform strapped or bolted to its back for carrying a Skaven Warlord to battle.

name: Amber Amulet
text: This enchanted talisman is carved from the heart of the largest black tree in the Petrified Forest.

name: Amulet of Fire
text: Though the Amulet of Fire constantly flickers with pale flames, the wearer is never burned, and is more resistant to magic.

name: Amulet of Foresight
text: The bearer of this amethyst amulet knows things no mortal should.

name: Crown of Black Iron
text: A dark crown, that will ensorcel the heart of those that bear it.

name: Deathmask
text: Made from gold of the Blackspine Mountains, the Deathmask depicts Khaine in his aspect of the Deathbringer.

name: Emerald Collar
text: The Emerald Collar is a gold band encrusted with cursed stones.

name: Foul Pendant
text: These pendants are tokens in the form of a simple rat skull strung upon an iron chain. They are 'gifts' from the Council of Thirteen.

name: Glyph Necklace
text: An ancient and potent token of protection this necklace wards off attacks and those of spiteful intent.

name: Golden Crown of Atrazar
text: Few wear the Golden Crown for long; the souls of the dead hang heavy about its brow, despite considerable arcane protections.

name: Ring of Darkness
text: Billowing black smoke emerges from the opal set into this ring, obscuring the wearer's position.

name: Talisman of Saphery
text: The size of the artefact known as the Talisman of Saphery belies its power, negating the effects of enchanted weapons against the bearer.

name: The Black Amulet
text: The amulet is a lustrous polished stone with a midnight hue, engraved with a single spiteful rune.

name: Vambraces of Defence
text: These golden bracers are fabled to have been found on the shores of distant Lustria and are inscribed with unusual glyphs.

name: Aventurine Dagger
text: A single green gem adorns the hilt and a terrible poison is smeared upon its blade.

name: Blade of Corruption
text: This sword has been left for thirteen days in the dreaded Cauldron of One Thousand Poxes; now a foul green fluid drips from its edge.

name: Blade of Darting Steel
text: Bright blue steel can be enchanted to hold spells of great speed and deadly accuracy; the Elves of Ulthuan are masters of such magic.

name: Blade of Leaping Gold
text: To the valiant, this blade lends supernatural speed and vigour; to the craven and corrupt, it brings only swift death.

name: Blade of Nurglitch
text: Smeared with special ointments of the Plaguelords, even a scratch from this blade can cause a lethal infection.

name: Blade of Revered Tzunki
text: Said to be the weapon wielded by the Old One Tzunki, this exquisitely crafted weapon is unbreakable and hums as it cuts through the air.

name: Blade of Ruin
text: The Blade of Ruin is not one to be wielded lightly; its owner stands to lose as much as its victim.

name: Blade of Sea Gold
text: This gleaming blade is found in the watery depths and honed by crashing waves. It strikes with the unstoppable power of the sea itself.

name: Burning Blade of Chotec
text: An acrid smell of sulphur exudes from its barbed blades.

name: Caledor's Bane
text: A dire lance, etched with the fiery blood of Dragons. It is much feared by High Elf Princes from the realm of Caledor.

name: Cobra Mace of Mazdamundi
text: This mace has a life of its own; it strikes out with lightning speed to bite enemy weapons before a blow is struck.

name: Crimson Death
text: This halberd was carried by Lord Khalak of Ghrond, the first Captain of the Black Guard. It has been passed down to every successor since.

name: Dagger of Hotek
text: Created by Hotek, a renegade priest of Vaul, this blade of obsidian allows the wielder to strike with blinding speed.

name: Dagger of Sotek
text: This ceremonial dagger has taken thousands of sacrifices to the bloodthirsty Sotek, but there is always a need for more…

name: Deathpiercer
text: A terrible weapon - a lance tipped with a blade carved from Cold One teeth, that leaves ragged wounds ensuring victims bleed painfully to death.

name: Dwarfbane
text: A Skaven weapon forged specifically for killing the hated Beard-things. Die-die!

name: Executioner's Axe
text: A large, bladed weapon bound with spells of dismemberment.

name: Foe Bane
text: This twisted blade was taken from the body of a Chaos Champion. Why he should have carried it not known, along with the name of his Elven slayer.

name: Heartseeker
text: Heartseeker has an uncanny ability to find the heart of a living thing. Dark Elves delight in its ability to destroy the lifeforce of their victims.

name: Mechanical Claw
text: Woe to those who fall within its grasp, for the claw is strong enough to crush a Troll's skull.

name: Revered Spear of Tlanxla
text: An unspeakably powerful weapon once said to have been wielded by the warlike Old One deity, Tlanxla.

name: Righteous Wrath
text: Forged by fallen Priests of Vaul and fuelled by the blood of sacrificial victims.

name: Scimitar of the Sun Resplendent
text: As light as a dagger, this curved blade invigorates the wielder with the power of the sun, fuelling his charge with fiery vigour.

name: Sea Gold Parrying Blade
text: An exquisite  sword forged from minerals found in the sea; no matter its wielder, no enemy will get a clean blow.

name: Stegadon War-Spear
text: The tip of this massive spear was carved from the horn of the very first Stegadon to bear a war howdah.

name: Sword of the Hornet
text: When this sword is unsheathed, a strange buzzing hum is heard forewarning the bearer of his enemy's attack.

name: The Blade of Realities
text: Brought to the world by the Old Ones, this weapon shimmers in and out of existence, severing the souls of anything living it touches.

name: The Fellblade
text: The sword of swords, created by the Skaven to destroy the greatest Necromancer to ever walk the world. It is a doomed thing.

name: The Piranha Blade
text: This weapon is inlaid with a thousand tiny barbed teeth, that still require feeding!

name: Moon Lance
text: Forged from the metal of a fallen star, this weapon's graceful lines belie the formidable power it grants its wielder.

name: The White Sword
text: A legendary blade forged by Aren, one of the first Swordmasters of Hoeth. It is as tall as an Elf and as light as a willow switch.

name: Venom Sword
text: Quenched in the poison of a thousand malicious serpents; when it strikes, poison flows into the veins of its victims.

name: Warlock-Augmented Weapon
text: This weapon is attached to a Warp-generator that channels crackling energy along its blade.

name: Warp-Forged Blade
text: Warpstone powder mixed with steel during the forging process creates a weapon of wicked cutting prowess.

name: Corrosive Blade
text: This weapon weeps a corrosive venom that can melt through armour to help deliver the poisoned point.

name: Wrath of Kurnous
text: Whenever the God of the Savage Hunt's name is invoked blood shall flow, one way or another.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Karaghul
text: Bretonnian dragon slayer blade

name: Gotrek's Rune Axe
text: Axe crafted by Grimnir

name: War Boar
text: The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

name: Arachnarok Spider (Catchweb Spidershrine)
text: This enormous, revolting Arachnarok Spider shrine upon which the Shaman is borne forces even the branches of nearby trees to twist in revulsion at its diabolical passing.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Great Stag
text: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

name: Bracchus
text: No creature outmatches the Black Dragon Bracchus in terms of sheer cruelty and the ability to inflict pain, save for Rakarth himself!

name: Manticore
text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

name: Scourgerunner Chariot
text: Dark Elf Beastmasters roam the wilds atop their dreaded chariots, armed with barbed nets and harpoons to slay the foe and ensnare their prey.

name: Barbarian
text: Some Marauders walk openly within the lands of other races, not seen as a threat but a northern foreigner - a barbarian. But they are wrong, he is a threat.

name: Beast Tamer
text: There are many monsters in the northern wastes - creatures that will eat a man no matter which god he worships. A tribe's Beast Tamer can bring such monsters to heel… if he has the talent.

name: Collector
text: Some nobles of the mortal nations - the rich ones - take to buying antiquities and cursed items. Their ignorance in unearthing such relics is our ally.

name: Cultist
text: The servants of Chaos are more than the barbarous Northmen - throughout the mortal realms secret cults worship the true Gods, and so our plans advance.

name: Darksoul
text: Said to have come from the ruins of Mordheim, Darksouls do not age and await the return of the Daemons that once possessed them.

name: Demagogue
text: "Listen brave men of the Empire - pray! But not to Sigmar, he cares not for YOU. There are other Gods who are willing to answer your prayers..."

name: Huscarl
text: Huscarls are Norse tribesmen that honourably serve their Chieftain - a manservant and shieldbearer both.

name: Kurgan Chieftain
text: The Kurgan are a tribe that could end all others - such are their numbers. Best keep this Chieftain as an ally.

name: Magister
text: The Magister - or whatever name a cult leader abides by - is a powerful, covert agent of Chaos, tending to flocks of the corrupted within the mortal lands.

name: Mutant
text: Mutants are shunned by so-called civilised societies but welcomed by the tribes of the north... and their omnipotent patrons.

name: Oar Slave
text: "Stroke, stroke - keep up or I'll feed yer to the Blood God's hounds!"

name: Possessed
text: There are souls that have been truly blessed by the Gods - not quite Spawn - but have received many gifts nonetheless.

name: Slave Master
text: The Slave Master takes the thralls taken on the raids and prepares them for bloody sacrifice or, even worse, a grisly life of servitude.

name: Zealot
text: "I am my master's tool - my God's vessel. Use me!"

name: Chaos Dragon
text: Once proud and majestic beasts, but now corrupted, malevolent creatures who bear a Chaos Lord into battle - they are the twin-headed Dragons of Chaos.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails that drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Chaos Dragon
text: Once proud and majestic beasts, but now corrupted, malevolent creatures who bear a Chaos Lord into battle - they are the twin-headed Dragons of Chaos.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Manticore
text: Even Chaos Lords struggle to tame Manticores, so for an exalted one to break the will of such a ferocious monstrosity? Then he must surely be destined for greatness.

name: Warhorse
text: Not all horses that roam the northlands are Chaos Steeds, but even mortal stallions from the north are proud beasts worthy of any Lord.

name: Hagtree Fetish
text: A crude effigy and shamanic heirloom from one of the hag trees that grow deep in the forest.

name: Jagged Dagger
text: A potent sacrificial tool that radiates the wrath of a thousand different offerings to the Dark Gods.

name: Skull of Rarkos
text: The bleached skull of the long-dead Great Bray-Shaman, Rarkos, is mounted upon the bearer's staff.

name: Staff of Darkoth
text: This staff, and wielder, are crawling with bugs and other nasties that can be sent forth on a whim.

name: Blackened Plate
text: This battered suit of ramshackle plate mail is covered with the soot from man's burned palaces and temples.

name: Pelt of the Shadowgave
text: A rotting pelt, shrouded in dark tendrils of malice that only the bravest or foolish should wear.

name: Ramhorn Helm
text: A headdress with two great ram horns that meld into the wearer's own, allowing him to deliver a devastating head-butt!

name: The Dark Mail
text: This ancient suit of chainmail can counter the fanciful enchantments and magicks of enemy blades.

name: Trollhide
text: Trollhide confers some of the more gruesome abilities of its former occupant to the wearer!

name: Horn of the First Beast
text: When this ancient, fossilised horn is sounded a cloud of disarray falls upon the enemy but emboldens the Gors.

name: Shard of the Herdstone
text: A sliver of strangely glowing stone that when cast to the ground will generate a tremendous gust of magical wind.

name: Bray-Shaman’s Familiar
text: As a speaker of spells and caster of magicks, a Bray-Shaman can summon a magical servant to aid him in his darkling duties.

name: Chieftain’s Pet
text: This hound doesn't reside with the others, it remains close to the Chieftain, a dangerous pet desperate to please its master.

name: Doe
text: Female Beastmen are rare. Oft-timid beasts, they carry the true-horn's seed and mother the next generation.

name: Flayer
text: This Gor is skilled with flint knife able to separate skin from flesh, whether the subject is dead or still breathing.

name: Flying Spy
text: This harpy is loyal to the Chieftain, and will break through the tree canopy to fly high and spy out the land.

name: Herdstone Keeper
text: Some Gors are tasked to look after the Herdstones, their reward oft-being sacrifice at the stone they kept in life.

name: Mannish Thrall
text: Some Beastmen are mongrels with minor mutations. Though they live their pathetic lives amongst men, their true loyalty is to the herd.

name: Pox-Carrier
text: Nurgors are diseased Beastmen with rotting horns and blemished skin, oft-shunned by the herd and sent to bring ruin.

name: Spawn-Wrangler
text: Chaos Spawn are not easy to control and corral, but some Gors are deft at doing just that.

name: Ungor Whelp
text: This scrawny Ungor is kept collared and close to the Chieftain - attending his needs, carrying his food, getting kicked and beaten.

name: The Banner of Outrage
text: This banner takes the form of a legendary standard torn from the grip of its dying owner and desecrated.

name: Banner of the Fallen Kings
text: Once a proud standard of one of mankind’s petty nations; it is now a wretched trophy blessed with all the Dark Gods’ malice and vainglory.

name: Manbane Standard
text: This standard - an ever-rotting corpse beset by carrion birds - is a gross mockery of a scarecrow.

name: The Beast Banner
text: This ancient banner is stitched together with sinew from the skins of defeated enemies.

name: Totem of Rust
text: A jagged spike with the corroded remains of armoured warriors impaled; this totem spreads an aura of entropy.

name: Gift of Chaos
text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

name: Gift of Chaos
text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

name: Gift of Chaos
text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

name: Gift of Chaos
text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

name: Gift of Chaos
text: The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Griffon
text: A Griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The large, broad steeds favoured by the Knights and nobles of the Empire have a temperament to match their size.

name: Chalice of Dark Rain
text: Made from the skull of a geomancer - when filled with soil, the chalice can summon a deluge of blood-soaked mud.

name: Icons of Vilification
text: These cursed items are all manner of blasphemy, from skulls of dead priests to hallowed, torn branches of Loren.

name: Axe of Men
text: The Axe of Men is so-called because it hacks through men as easily as other, lesser axes, hew timber.

name: Axes of Khorgor
text: When the Banebeast Khorgor was finally slain, his powerful, half-sentient axes went missing shortly after.

name: Everbleed
text: This infamous blade bears a potent blood magick - even a slight cut will erupt in a geyser of gore.

name: Hunting Spear
text: Made to fell the Mammuts of the far north, this spear bears enchantments that allow it to penetrate deep into flesh.

name: Mangelder
text: Mangelder saps the strength of mind as well as body. It is a weapon rightly feared across the Old World.

name: Primeval Club
text: Draw your strength from the enemy’s courage; strike with equal power.

name: Scourge
text: Scourge is a lethal whip, thirsty for blood and wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.

name: Stonecrusher Mace
text: A great, blunt weapon with an iron beast-head at its tip - a symbol of the Beastmen's desire to unmake all.

name: The Brass Cleaver
text: The Brass Cleaver is said to be an artefact from another realm - ancient and terrible, it thirsts for blood.

name: The Steel Claws
text: Made from the shards of Elven weapons, this set of splintered blades fits over the user's own talons.

name: Razorgor Chariot
text: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.

name: Razorgor Chariot
text: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.

name: Razorgor Chariot
text: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.
