name: Razorgor Chariot
text: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.

name: The Liber Noctus
text: This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The large, broad steeds favoured by the Knights and nobles of the Empire have a temperament to match their size.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: War Altar of Sigmar
text: The altar prominently features a noble griffon bearing Ghal Maraz, Sigmar’s hammer and the emblem of Imperial unity and strength.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The large, broad steeds favoured by the Knights and nobles of the Empire have a temperament to match their size.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: The Brothers Ghorst Corpse Cart
text: Ghorst and his Undead brothers, forever on the road to damnation. Even death cannot break the bond between them.

name: Corpse Cart
text: Corpse Carts act like magnets for Dark Magic, drawing their power from the land itself and re-animating the dead around them.

name: Corpse Cart (Balefire)
text: Its brazier burning with supernatural flames, the Cart spits Warpstone – and the madness therein – upon enemy Wizards in its path.

name: Corpse Cart (Unholy Lodestone)
text: Some Corpse Carts have a great bell mounted upon them, its ominous knell drawing the dead back to shambling Unlife.

name: Corpse Cart
text: Its brazier burning with supernatural flames, the Cart spits Warpstone – and the madness therein – upon enemy Wizards in its path.

name: Corpse Cart (Balefire)
text: Corpse Carts act like magnets for Dark Magic, drawing their power from the land itself and re-animating the dead around them.

name: Corpse Cart (Unholy Lodestone)
text: Some Corpse Carts have a great bell mounted upon them, its ominous knell drawing the dead back to shambling Unlife.

name: Terrorgheist
text: Deadly giant bats the size of dragons, capable of plucking men from the field and stunning warhorses into paralysis.

name: Jade Griffon
text: This small idol shimmers with an eerie green light, bestowing unnatural regenerative powers upon the wearer.

name: The Carstein Ring
text: An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.

name: Blood Drinker
text: This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.

name: Staff of Command
text: This stave is imbued with the right to lead, so that power and authority pervades its holder.

name: The Helm of the Hunt
text: The last relic of Gwynthraul's legendary quest; any who wear it are charged with his renowned strength and vigour.

name: Hail of Doom Arrow
text: These arrows shower their targets with dozens of razor-sharp shards; a percussive shot of death.

name: Horn of the Wild Hunt
text: When this ancient and revered relic is blown, all Elven forces are driven to the Hunt with a savage determination.

name: Dryad Spy
text: In a forest, there is no finer spy than a tree.

name: Elder Scout
text: The eldest of Athel Loren's scouts have visited areas of the forest their younger counterparts do not yet know exist.

name: Eternal Guard Commander
text: Commanders of the Eternal Guard; the finest of the finest.

name: Forest Spirit
text: A spirit of Athel Loren, while incorporeal, can be sensed by all who dwell within its Waystone bounds.

name: Hawk Companion
text: A trusty hawk is its handler's eyes in the sky, scouting for danger.

name: Hunting Hound
text: A loyal hound, tried, tested and as much a killer as any bow-armed Elf.

name: Royal Standard Bearer
text: Those who march under the banner of the Hunter King and his Eternal Queen do so with true meaning in every step.

name: Vaul's Anvil Smith
text: An outbreak of fire in the forest is generally a bad thing, but not when this one is forging the finest weapons, however.

name: Wardancer Drummer
text: Sometimes even the forest's chosen warriors wish their approach to be signalled; it's psychology in action.

name: Young Stag
text: Forest dwellers beware, lest you are watched, followed and taken, never to be seen again.

name: The Banner of the Eternal Queen
text: Those who go to battle with the Everqueen's personally hand-woven banner do so proudly, and never waver.

name: The Banner of the Hunter King
text: Though tattered and ancient, this banner causes forces to charge - in the name of the Hunt - before the main Elven host.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Forest Dragon
text: Hailing from deep within the forests of the Old World, this dragon breathes deadly, poisonous fumes instead of fire.

name: Forest Dragon
text: Hailing from deep within the forests of the Old World, this dragon breathes deadly, poisonous fumes instead of fire.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Elven Steed
text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

name: Great Eagle
text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Cloak of Isha
text: This cloak, renewed annually by Ariel herself, is all Orion needs to protect himself.

name: Daith's Reaper
text: Forged from a Khainite shard by the greatest Elven smith, this weapon can break through even the firmest of armours.

name: Sword of Daith
text: This blade, like Durthu himself, is steeped in millennia of bitterness and rage waiting to be unleashed.

name: Spear of Kurnous
text: When Orion hurls this living weapon with fierce purpose it fells the most powerful foes before returning to its master.

name: The Bow of Loren
text: Made with a single, pristine hair from Queen Ariel, the Bow of Loren is a weapon without peer.

name: The Spirit Sword
text: This crystal-forged blade cuts through more than flesh - it feasts on the soul, leaving wounds that never heal.

name: Squiggly Beast
text: Once a Shaman, now a beast transformed by Wurrzag and retained as an example of Da Great Green Prophet's might.

name: Shield of Defiance
text: This shield is inscribed with powerful runes of protection that turn away even the most rending of blows.

name: Baleful Mask
text: This gnarled and fearsome visor is riddled with eerie power which emanates from its bored-out eye sockets.

name: Skarsnik's Bad Moon Banner
text: When the leering yellow face of the Bad Moon Banner rises, all Night Goblins swell with an insane blend of daring and battle-madness!

name: Anvil of Doom
text: Covered in the Runelord’s ancient script, the anvil has given form to the most powerful runic weapons ever forged.

name: Great Cave Squig
text: As large as an Imperial warhorse and thrice as fierce – a most appropriate mount for a Night Goblin Warboss!

name: Spleenrippa
text: Savage and ill-tempered - even for a Warboar - Spleenrippa takes Wurrzag wherever Da Great Green Prophet’s lunacy dictates.

name: Rune of Fury
text: Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.

name: Rune of Might
text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.

name: Rune of Parrying
text: A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.

name: Rune of Striking
text: The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.

name: Bonewood Staff
text: Covered in magical glyphs, this staff protects Wurrzag from the many magical machinations ranged against him.

name: Skarsnik's Prodder
text: Skarsnik's pointed staff, pulsating with magical energy, channels the might of Gork (or Mork) to lance out with weird, terrifying power.

name: The Hammer of Angrund
text: Soaked in centuries of Greenskin blood, the Ironhammer has been handed down to every rightful Angrund ruler of the Eight Peaks.

name: The Chalice of Potions
text: The pellet with the poison is in the vessel with the pestle; the chalice from the palace has the brew that is true…

name: Armour of the Midsummer Sun
text: These enchanted plates channel sunlight, so beams of light burst forth to blind the foe as the wearer approaches.

name: Cuirass of Fortune
text: Although madder than a bag of exceptionally angry wasps, Gurdilloue forged this breastplate to instil luck and accuracy in its wearer.

name: Gilded Cuirass
text: This breastplate, inscribed with the Grail Vow, knits otherwise mortal wounds together so its wearer can fight another day.

name: The Grail Shield
text: Blessed by each of the Grail Companions, this shield ensures its bearer does not age whilst carrying it to war and quest.

name: Holy Icon
text: A priceless artefact, this triptych of the Lady ingrains the faith to defeat most magical attacks ranged against its bearer.

name: Mane of the Purebreed
text: When woven within a living horse’s mane, hair from Gille’s steed confers strength and resilience into mounts of the same noble bloodline.

name: Sacrament of the Lady
text: These wafers are blessed by the Lady, causing throes of ecstasy and religious visions to flood the mind when eaten.

name: Banner of Defence
text: The interlocking pattern adorning this banner has the power to stop almost anything in its tracks, even a cannonball.

name: Errantry Banner
text: Great zeal and god-like strength are infused within those who bear this well-travelled banner, ensuring they fight like heroes of yore.

name: Twilight Banner
text: This banner, embroidered with nymphs’ hair, enables the unit beneath to blend with its surroundings and pass through solid objects.

name: Valorous Standard
text: Glorious thoughts consume Knights who ride ‘neath this enchanted banner, enabling them to take on much larger forces than their own.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The Dukes of Bretonnia will command their hosts of Knights from the backs of mighty barded steeds.

name: Tempete
text: Taming a mighty Hippogryph presents a challenge that many Bretonnian lords cannot turn down.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Damsel where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Damsel where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Unicorn
text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Damsel where her magical gifts are needed most.

name: Silvaron
text: This proud and noble Unicorn elevates the Enchantress above her host, so all may see and be strengthened by her blessed presence.

name: Shadowsteed
text: This magical steed carries the Green Knight into battle, to destroy those that oppose Bretonnia.

name: Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

name: Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Dragon's Claw
text: Malgrimace’s claw has been enchanted by Damsels, enabling its bearer to walk through fire and emerge entirely unharmed.

name: Sirienne's Locket
text: When worn directly above the heart, this locket gifts the Damsel Sirienne’s suitors with the protection of the Lady.

name: Sword of the Lady's Champion
text: The Knight who prays beside water before battle may see the Lady’s hand emerge, offering a perfect blade to her noble champion.

name: Sword of the Quest
text: Passed down from Knight to Knight, this hefty blade requires a hand-and-a-half to wield it correctly.

name: The Silver Lance of the Blessed
text: Forged by Gilles the Uniter himself, this lance instantly turns all but the purest, bravest souls to fire.

name: The Wyrmlance
text: Fearnought’s lance allows its bearer to breath fire upon enemies whenever the name of the slain Dragon, Malifex, is uttered.

name: Trident of Manann
text: The Sea God’s rage is channelled through the trident’s prongs, smashing his enemies like waves against the rocks.

name: Bloodstained Armour of Morkar
text: Morkar was first of the Everchosen; his armour is charged with Ruinous power and caked with the blood of many thousands of victims.

name: Reaver's Helm
text: This fine casque was once worn by an expert looter; somehow, some part of his natural instincts remain.

name: Huskarl Plates
text: This armour was once worn by one who was either exalted to Champion-status or who fell in battle, but not before attracting the Dark Powers' attention.

name: Mammoth-Hide Cape
text: The thick, blubbering hide of the Mammoth, although heavy, provides excellent protection for the wearer against arrow and blades alike.

name: Ancient Frost-Wyrm Scale
text: The impossibly-harsh climate in which the Frost-Wyrms live ensures their scales bolster armour's effectiveness whilst burning any foe who touches them with intense cold.

name: Arachnarok Eggs
text: Each egg contains deadly spiderlings, to swarm over and bite the foe's body, injecting deadly venom into the wounds.

name: Frost-Wyrm Scale
text: The impossibly-harsh climate in which the Frost-Wyrms live ensures their scales bolster armour's effectiveness whilst burning any foe who touches them with intense cold.

name: Dragon Ogre's Great Horn
text: When blown, the Great Horn calls up a thunderstorm which forces the bearer's enemies back with high winds and lightning strikes.

name: Manticore Horn
text: Anyone who tries to slay a Manticore and lives to tell the tale must be braver than he looks.

name: Vial of Troll Blood
text: Disgusting as it may be, a shot of Troll blood is just the thing to bolster the drinker's courage, causing an unstoppable bloodlust to rise within them.

name: Baernsonling Berserker
text: This absolute nutter is even a match for most other berserkers, such is his unrestrained axe-rage. Have him on *your* side, yeah?

name: Graeling Werekin
text: From one of the seven dominant tribes of Norsca, this abject fiend attracts better-than-average Skin Wolves to the pack... and the hunt that surely follows.

name: Berserker
text: A wild and unruly beast of a man, good in a fight and… well, that's about it.

name: Cathay Slave Dancers
text: "Conditions are going to be pretty harsh, and the pay will vary depending on performance, but you do get to look at them... Fight well, kill plenty, and you might get to touch."

name: Dragonbone Raiders
text: These battle-hardened, merciless warriors are experts in sacking, looting, and the carnage that ensues. Plunder and killings are their reasons to be.

name: Kurgan Slave Merchant
text: "I am the strongest - I am the one… and my wares are the finest you'll see around these parts, I'll wager!"

name: Mammoth Tamer
text: It is no easy task to secure the cooperation of such a large, hairy, foul smelling beast; the same can be said of the mammoths this man tames.

name: Marauder Brute
text: Spectacularly brutal and lacking even the faintest glimmer of mercy, this one is well on the road to be noticed by the ever-fickle Chaos Gods.

name: Mountain Scout
text: While some peaks of the Norscan mountain ranges remain impassable, this man has traversed those that can be crossed.

name: Seer
text: This one tends a shrine to one of the Ruinous Powers, braving their unpredictable cruelty and random transformation to guide the Norse warriors to exaltation.

name: Skaeling Trader
text: The Claws of Skael have another line besides brutal murder; as it turns out, some of their number have a nose for business...

name: Slave Worker
text: There's always work to be done and, somewhat predictably, the living spoils of the Norscans' raids are the ones who must do it, or die!

name: Varag's Beast Trainer
text: When Varag Skulltaker fell in battle he left behind some really useful retainers...

name: Whalers
text: In civilised parts, whaling is considered deplorable at best. However, whales from the Sea of Claws have a taste for mortal blood – and we all have to eat after all.

name: Last of the Great Mawherd
text: Mammoths can be tricky to control, but if they can clearly see their offspring in danger… well, let's just say it's best to stay out of their path!

name: Wolfclaw Banner
text: You'll feel their heat just a moment behind...

name: Banner of the Black-Iron Reavers
text: Mortkin's personal warhird were ravagers without peer; the glory of their many savage achievements is soaked into the ancient, tattered canvas.

name: Banner of the Crimson Reapers
text: "Hear the choirs; is it the wind that brought back their cries? Once forged in blood by tragedy, sharp were the thorns of crimson death!"

name: Drake Hunters' Banner
text: The ability to bring down a Frost-Wyrm or Ice Drake marks one out as special among the sagas of the Northmen.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Norscan Warhorse
text: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

name: War Mammoth
text: Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.

name: Chaos Dragon
text: Once proud and majestic beasts, but now corrupted, malevolent creatures who bear a Chaos Lord into battle - they are the twin-headed Dragons of Chaos.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Norscan Warhorse
text: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Norscan Warhorse
text: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Norscan Warhorse
text: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Norscan Warhorse
text: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

name: War Mammoth
text: Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.

name: Giant Cygor Eyeball
text: For just a fraction of a split-second, the eyeball appears to be looking at you too... despite being dead. Brrrrr!

name: Berserker's Headband
text: It probably contains the sweat of a complete, card-carrying nutjob. Imagine what you'd become if just a drop got inside your body...

name: Marauder's Lootbag
text: You have to have somewhere to stash those ill-gotten gains; in the absence of enormous breeches, a bag made from animal hide is usually sufficient.

name: Slave Chain
text: One more impossible cruelty atop all the others; well, you wouldn't want the poor unfortunates to escape, would you?

name: Terrorgheist Skull
text: In death, a Terrorgheist may even be more deadly than when alive - its terrifying countenance improving the bearer's abilities by removing the need to rest in between uses.

name: The Wintertooth Crown
text: Whether by the crown's own properties, or by the grace of the Dark Gods, all things bestial and savage obey the wearer.

name: Wolf-Teeth Amulet
text: The thrill of the hunt; the ecstasy of the kill.

name: Fimir Hammer
text: Some of the most vicious, deadly creatures in the world just got deadlier and even more vicious!

name: Flaming Axe of Cormac
text: "These are days of great power: the tribes of the North, the beasts of the forest and a great prince of Kharnath will baptise this world in blood!"

name: Forest Dragon Fang
text: Deadly poison drips from the Dragon's fangs; a scratch is just enough to send their searing venom coursing through the unfortunate foe's veins.

name: Stinky Giant Club
text: Both the Giant and his club smell absolutely repulsive, their repellent odour discouraging foes just long enough for this blunt instrument to do its messy work.

name: Sword of Torgald
text: Although King Torgald's blade is a prized trophy, it is also an eternal reminder of the consequences of grand proclamations afore the Gods.

name: Troll-Fang Dagger
text: Considering it's definitely never been cleaned, this decayed tooth is surprisingly strong; when it pierces skin the poison seeps in. Death tends to follow soon after.

name: Marauder Chariot
text: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

name: Band of Loyalty
text: He who wears this ring is respected by everyone around him, whether he deserves it or not…

name: Tear of Shallya
text: This beautiful green emerald has been imbued with powerful healing incantations of the Cult of Shallya.

name: Stalker
text: A useful thing - easily concealed and with a power that surprises whomever sees it in action.

name: The Anguish of L'Anguille
text: A lavish but deadly blade which once belonged to Rodrik’s highest-ranking bodyguard.

name: Dawn
text: Masterfully crafted in every way, this precision bow puts similar weapons to shame.

name: Book of Ashur
text: This arcane tome, bound in ancient dragon hide, contains much wisdom on the conjuring and subjugation of spells.

name: Lucky Shrunken Head
text: There are few charms as potent as the grisly shrunken head of some forgotten enemy. The poor git!

name: Skull Staff
text: The jaws of the Skull Staff chatter and gnash, warning Kemmler of baleful magic in his vicinity.

name: Staff of Volans
text: The Staff of Volans has ever been the symbol of the Supreme Patriarch's office, allowing Gelt to bend the Winds of Magic to his will.

name: Armour of Destiny
text: The Armour of Destiny is worn by a great Hero among every generation, their fate entwined with the ensorcelled suit.

name: Armour of Fortune
text: Those who don the Armour of Fortune seem to have the favour of Ranald, able to parry the lethal blow with a lucky deflection.

name: Armour of Gork
text: Bashed out of the blackest metals of the underground together with the reforged suits of slain stunties, this armour is thick, heavy and said to be blessed by Gork. Well… he spat on it anyway.

name: Armour of Silvered Steel
text: The gleaming, all-encasing suit of silver is light but still grants the wearer a heavy degree of protection - surely, the hallmarks of Elven artifice.

name: Armour of Templehof
text: A product of twisted sorcery, this construct fuses with the wearer, giving him tremendous endurance.

name: Azhag's 'Ard Armour
text: By the grace of Gork (or Mork), Azhag’s magical armour is so ‘ard, it can even protect those around him.

name: Blood-Forged Armour
text: The cooling of this armour in the blood of Dwarf Runesmiths has imbued it with great powers – some explosive in nature!

name: Dragonhelm
text: An ornate helm fashioned in the style of dragon scales, allowing the wearer to shrug off burning flame and bolts of fire.

name: Enchanted Shield
text: Such a shield has been enchanted by a Wizard or blessed by a Priest to give its wearer greater protection.

name: Gambler's Armour
text: Ranald, the God of Thieves, Tricksters and Gamblers has blessed the armour and those who are willing to take a chance.

name: Magnificent Armour of Borek Beetlebrow
text: To rid Karak Hirn of two despicable giants, Borek fashioned this suit of exquisite Gromril armour that glows with several master runes.

name: Nightshroud
text: Discovered in a vault deep inside Castle Drachenfels, the aura of gloom that clings to the Nightshroud is so strong it physically manifests as armour.

name: Shield of Ptolos
text: First discovered in the far south by tomb raiders, the Shield of Ptolos grants the wielder a great defensive boon against missile attacks.

name: Spellshield
text: This shield is branded with wards of arcane protection, it has had many owners in its storied past.

name: The Armour of Meteoric Iron
text: Forged from a rare star-metal, it is said that no mortal blade can piece the Armour of Meteoric Iron.

name: The Armour of Morkar
text: Once belonging to the First Everchosen of Chaos, this ancient suit of Chaos Armour is as powerful as those who have dared to wear it.

name: The Armour of Skaldour
text: Protected by powerful runes, the Armour of Skaldour has turned countless blades away from the High King in both battle and during assassination attempts.

name: The Lion's Shield
text: King Louen carries the shield that has been worked on by Bretonnia’s greatest artisans and enchanted by Prophetesses to become a mighty artefact.

name: The Slayer Crown
text: This majestic, horned helmet has been worn by every Slayer King since the time of King Baragor.

name: Trickster's Helm
text: A dingy, battered helmet that looks like any other – but this is the Trickster’s Helm, a powerful artefact that protects the wearer.

name: Cloak of Mists & Shadows
text: Kemmler is surrounded by a dark cloak that swirls and twists with a life of its own.

name: Cloak of Molten Metal
text: This mystic robe creates a shimmering series of images that match and refract Gelt’s appearance to confuse and befuddle any attacking foe.

name: Ironcurse Icon
text: This enchanted item - made from the cannonball that killed infamous Necromancer Gabriel Dumort - grants the wielder advantage when facing the missile attacks of war machines.

name: The Crown of Bretonnia
text: Blessed by a kiss from the Lady, this crown has been an ancient symbol of leadership since the coronation of King Louis the Rash.

name: The Crown of Sorcery
text: The Crown of Sorcery was found in the ruins of Todtheim by Azhag the Slaughterer. Its malign influence has helped the Warboss carve a path of destruction throughout the Empire, for the Crown whispers advice and grants the wearer the power of Death Magic.

name: The Great Book of Grudges
text: The Dammaz Kron recounts every deed of infamy perpetuated against the Dwarfs, scribed in the blood of kings and infused with vows of vengeance.

name: The Terrifying Mask of Eee!
text: Never look upon the Terrifying Mask of Eee, you don’t know what you might see!

name: Hedge Wizard
text: Instinct, luck, and no magical training whatsoever. What could go wrong?

name: Bailiff
text: The hated face of Lordly imposition.

name: Boatman
text: The rivers of the Empire are vital arteries of communication and commerce.

name: Bodyguard
text: In a major metropolis, it's all too easy to end up with a knife in your back.

name: Bounty Hunter
text: The lone Bounty Hunter can go places that ungainly military units cannot.

name: Fisherman
text: These hearty souls brave the Sea of Claws in small craft, despite the constant threat of pirates and raiders.

name: Grave Robber
text: Obtaining corpses legally is quite difficult, you know…

name: Initiate
text: There are still many young men and women willing to devote their lives to the gods.

name: Kislevite Kossar
text: Many Kossars leave the constant wars of their homeland to become mercenaries and adventurers elsewhere.

name: Mercenary
text: When the war never ends, there is always a need for fighting men.

name: Militiaman
text: Even a small amount of training can be the difference between life and death on the blood-soaked battlefields of the Old World.

name: Pit Fighter
text: Men fight better when their livelihood, not just their lives, is at stake.

name: Outlaw
text: "Rob from the rich and give to the poor. That's the theory, anyway."

name: Outrider
text: Experienced outdoorsmen who reconnoitre for armies, caravans, and other travelling parties. Life expectancy is short.

name: Antagonist
text: "Professional bully wanted. Fair prices paid for beating the right people up."

name: Rogue
text: Never do an honest day's work if you can avoid it.

name: Servant
text: For the scullion, stable boy, and serving wench, escape from their hard lives often seems impossible - because generally it is.

name: Smuggler
text: Although illegal, most folks don't think much of cutting a few corners in the name of good business.

name: Soldier
text: Full-time, paid professionals to man the fortresses, patrol the borders, and repel invaders.

name: Thug
text: In the criminal underworld, strength and viciousness are highly-prized virtues.

name: Tollkeeper
text: Collecting money for the government is a thankless job. Doing so in the midst of the wilderness is practically a death sentence…

name: Tomb Robber
text: Bodies are two-a-penny; the valuables buried with them are worth much, much more.

name: Vagabond
text: Who wants to wake up in the same village or city every day, doing the same thing as yesterday? No? Thought not.

name: Valet
text: Responsible for the grooming, wardrobe, and presentation of their charges, a valet is indispensable for the style-conscious noble.

name: Zealot
text: Whatever their case, nothing is left for these men and women but religion - and the swift dispatch of the minions of evil and Chaos.

name: Student
text: From history to anatomy to science to nothing more than the bottom of a bottle…

name: Court Jester
text: The fool dressed in motley - a symbol of Bretonnia as much as the Grail.

name: Squire
text: As Knights in training, squires assist their masters on and off the field of battle.

name: Archivist
text: The keepers of the archive know the location of any account, history or lore held within the Dwarfhold's dusty archives.

name: Brewmaster
text: "The king be damned - every Dawi knows there is no more important a personage in this Hold than the Brewmaster!"

name: Candle Maker
text: Dwarf candle makers are always in demand. If you live underground you'll need light no matter the time of day - even if your eyes are suited to darkness.

name: Choir Master
text: A typical choirmaster's conundrum is how many verses of "She was Only a Halfling's Daughter" to regale the Elven ambassador with? The full 260? Or the shorter 180 stanza version?

name: Cooper
text: "What do you mean the Coopers' Guild isn't important? Tell me, lad, without our casks what would you store the black powder and beer in?"

name: Daughter of Valaya
text: Although rarely seen on the battlefield, the Kvinn - Khazalid for lady - also known as Valaya's Daughters, are often the real power behind a Hold's throne.

name: Dwarf Bride
text: A Dwarf bride often comes with a hefty dowry - by tradition her weight in gold. Which probably explains why hot-blooded Dwarfs take to curvier maids!

name: Dwarfen Tattooist
text: The ability to etch runes into Dwarf flesh will keep the spirit of the Karaz Ankor alive and well.

name: Goldsmith
text: Dwarfs can manipulate and shape gold as easy as wet clay, and Goldsmiths are masters of this craft.

name: Grudgekeeper
text: It is the Grudgekeeper's hallowed duty to keep the Hold's Book of Grudges up to date, expunging old grudges while adding new entries.

name: Guildmaster
text: The Guilds are as powerful as the Clans in Dwarf society - a Guildmaster can control or break a Hold's trade, should he be of a mind.

name: Jewelsmith
text: A Dwarf jeweller can weigh up, appraise and rate the clarity of a stone from across a room. An eyepiece is what umgi pretenders have to use.

name: Miner
text: Miners brave horrendous subterranean conditions, and horrors, in search of iron, silver, gold, gems, and other valuables.

name: Powdermaker
text: "What in Grungni's matted beard are you doing? Never - I mean never - bring a lit candle in here again!"

name: Prospector
text: "You can wave your pitchfork at me all you like, umgi, but I say there's gold under this farm and I mean to have it!"

name: Reckoner
text: The High King's Reckoners travel the Karaz Ankor inspecting a Hold's assets, making sure every stipend is paid and coin accounted for.

name: Runebearer
text: Communication between Dwarfholds is important. As such, these young Dwarfs risk life and limb to carry messages from one to another.

name: Runesmith Apprentice
text: Even for Dwarfs, Runesmiths are a grim sort; they very rarely take on aspirants, as worthy apprentices are hard to find.

name: Sapper
text: Dwarfs excel at digging - not the crude tunnels of Skaven and Goblins - but masterful underground passages. They can also use such skills when besieging the enemy.

name: Shieldbreaker
text: Elite soldiers who specialise in fighting deep underground, seeking to stem the tide of evil and safeguard their people.

name: Shipwright
text: A Dwarf shipwright has mastered the art of floating huge vessels of metal on water - a mystery to other races.

name: Slayer Ward
text: Those beardlings who slight their masters or fail in their apprenticeships may take the Slayer Oath in shame.

name: Stonemason
text: It was the stonemasons who discovered runic number-magic, allowing them to craft perfectly square stones. Manling scholars call such art "calculus".

name: Teller of Tales
text: Not an official title, but there is always one Longbeard in the feasting hall that can engross an audience with a fine tale - if offered a tankard of ale!

name: Treasure Hunter
text: "There's lost treasure down here, alright. Gold or gems, one or t'other. My beard can sense it. Just gotta mind those booby traps…"

name: Troll Slayer
text: Dwarfs who have been disgraced, crossed in love, or otherwise humiliated abandon traditional society and seek the sweet release of death. Fair enough, really.

name: Agitator
text: Whose skills include aggressive leaflet campaigns, rousing speeches, and generally stirring things up a bit…

name: Apprentice Wizard
text: Humans born with magical talent are dangerous and feared individuals.

name: Barber-Surgeon
text: Who provides painful but effective healing to the common folk of the Empire.

name: Bone Picker
text: "Any old iron? No? What about rags or bones?"

name: Burgher
text: The glue that holds urban society together.

name: Camp Follower
text: No army travels alone. Who else would cook, sew or loot the freshly slain?

name: Charcoal Burner
text: Wood is burned to create charcoal, an important fuel for the Winter months.

name: Coachman
text: The coachman risks life and limb to bring passengers and cargo safely through the hazards of the Imperial roadways.

name: Entertainer
text: Some do it for the roar of the crowd and others for the money.

name: Estalian Diestro
text: The bravest Estalians travel to the Empire to test their rapiers against worthy opponents.

name: Ferryman
text: Ferrymen make their living moving people and goods across the Empire's rivers, for a small fee of course.

name: Hunter
text: It takes skill to stalk wild animals while avoiding the dark creatures of the woods.

name: Jailer
text: The Empire is a nation of laws, and therefore also a nation of jails.

name: Light College Acolyte
text: The acolytes of the Light College channel cleansing Light Magic for their masters.

name: Marine
text: Ship-borne soldiers, marines protect their vessels from pirates, Norse marauders, and other raiders.

name: Messenger
text: With great distances separating the important cities and castles of the Empire, messengers are an indispensable means of communication.

name: Noble
text: The younger children of noble houses must often make their own way in the world, amongst the lower classes, adventurers, and ne'er-do-wells.

name: Peasant
text: "Ooooo master, there's some lovely filth over here…"

name: Rat Catcher
text: It’s a dirty job, but it helps keep the plague away.

name: Road Warden
text: These lawmen patrol the roads and tracks of the Empire, protecting travellers and their goods.

name: Scribe
text: Some scribes tire of reading about the adventures of others and resolve to have some of their own.

name: Seaman
text: On blood-soaked decks, seamen earn their rum ration and their booty.

name: Thief
text: Honest, hard-working citizens? Thieves are dedicated to taking as much of their money as possible.

name: Tradesman
text: Skilled labourers and craftsmen are an important part of the Empire's economy.

name: Watchman
text: Responsible for maintaining law and order, Watchmen are empowered to make arrests and fight fires where necessary.

name: Woodsman
text: Among the mighty forests of the Empire, Woodsmen look after the trees they will fell for timber.

name: Backstabba
text: Don't like some git? Then send in a backstabba, they're like nasty skulkers, but even meaner.

name: Bat-Winged Loony
text: "I'm gonna fly! Do da loop-de-loop! Watch me goooo!"

name: Boggart
text: Marsh-gobbos, or "boggarts", know all the "secret ways" in marshy, swampy areas. However, they're still "smelly gits" according to the Orcs.

name: Bully
text: Orc bullies are irascible, infirm and often incontinent old warriors who boss the war machine crews around.

name: Dog Boy Scout
text: Mounted on a giant shaggy wolf, this Goblin is a grizzled veteran, having run away from countless enemies in his time.

name: Dung Shovela
text: Greenskin encampments are often dominated by piles of poo. It's a useful material for daubing and throwing. The dung shovela has the "top job" of pilling it all up.

name: Gobbo Ranta
text: Greenskins don't have clergy in the normal sense, but some gobbos like to "preach" the will of da godz.

name: Idol Carva
text: Those idols of Gork 'n' Mork that appear around Greenskin camps? Someone 'as to carve 'em!

name: Pit Boss
text: Orcs like a good scrap in the local fighting pit. The pit boss sets up the fights and "keeps it all within da rulez".

name: Savage Orc Prodda
text: "Grrrr, we gonna get da zoggin gits! Get me prodda!"

name: Serial Loota
text: All gobbos are sneak-thieves, but this one has elevated stripping the dead of their valuables into an art form.

name: Shaman's Lackey
text: Orc Shamans rarely mix with others, unless when dancin' around the campfire. A lackey is there to fetch and carry for the Shaman and keep his interactions with the boyz to a minimum.

name: 'Shroom Gathera
text: It's not just Night Goblins that like fungus, all Greenskins do. 'Shroom gatheras go and get 'em - those that survive Squig attacks, that is.

name: Snotling Scavengers
text: Last in the queue behind the Orcs and Goblins when it comes to lootin', Snotlings will steal whatever they get their grubby little hands upon, ensuring nothing of value remains.

name: Spider-God Priest
text: The many-faceted eyes of the Feaster From Beyond demand worship, or He will not send his broodlings to serve.

name: Squig Mascot
text: A spheroid body with beady eyes and gaping, many-toothed maw, this Squig has doubtful merits as a pet but works wonders intimidating gobbos into obedience (or just eating them).

name: Swindla
text: "See dis? I'm gonna nick it, cos I'm a bit weeeey!"

name: Troll Herder
text: Trolls are stupid, that is a fact. So Orc troll herderz are employed to get the dumb gits where they're meant to be.

name: Fieldwarden
text: Halflings patrol the borders of the Moot, keeping away threats from unwanted outsiders.

name: Norse Berserker
text: A grim, northern land, full of Ice Trolls, Chaos Spawn, and a breed of tough fighters.

name: Black Cat
text: Cats are generally seen as lucky in the Empire, but black cats are said to be the familiars of warlocks and witches.

name: Carrion
text: Carrion are large, Undead, vulture-like creatures that are drawn to battlefields and Unholy summonings.

name: Corpse Thief
text: Corpses not interned in Morr's gardens straight away often find themselves on the black market.

name: Crone
text: "Come, child, come visit my modest hovel - it's just around the corner and there's cakes in the oven!"

name: Dreg
text: "Yes, master?"

name: Flesh Golem
text: This thing has no mind, it is a fleshy contraption powered by its master's will, used for mundane tasks and guarding the castle during daylight.

name: Grave Digger
text: "Pass me ma spade, I'm lookin' for gallows bait!

name: Manservant
text: Many Vampire Lords keep a mortal manservant around. After all, someone needs to dust the drapes.

name: Mortal Informer
text: There are foolish mortals - usually rich, noble, dilettante types - who crave immortality and will be a Vampire's willing spy for the chance of damnation.

name: Restless Spirit
text: Those spirits who are no longer bound to the mortal plane, but have thus far avoided Morr's grasp, can be tethered to a Vampire's service - for poltergeists have their uses...

name: Possessed Mirror
text: "Speculum, speculum on the wall, who is the cruellest of them all?"

name: Treasurer
text: While they started off as destitute nobles of Stirland, since becoming Undead the von Carsteins have accumulated great wealth. The treasurer is in charge of the master's vaults.

name: Warlock
text: Warlocks are those that practise the dark arts away from the overseers in the Colleges of Magic. They are the prey of Witch Hunters and more…

name: Warpstone Hunter
text: Warpstone is Dark Magic incarnate. Undead Lords, especially liches, will employ ghoulish hunters to find such precious ore.

name: Banner of Swiftness
text: No matter the weather, the Banner of Swiftness always flaps as if in a gale. Those who march under it, traverse the elements at a much greater pace.

name: Banner of the Barrows
text: Woven from the wind and the cold, the chill of this banner touches the hearts of those who stand before it, sapping their will and ability to fight.

name: Da Immortulz
text: The basic requirement for fighting under the banner of Grimgor’s hard-as-nails Black Orc retinue is, quite simply, to survive his incessant warmongering.

name: Lichbone Pennant
text: The sigil on this banner is old, and hurts the eyes to gaze upon it – yet those who walk under it in battle are protected by an arcane shield.

name: Mork's War Banner
text: After powerful rituals and plenty of Shaman mumbo-jumbo, this banner was left leaning against an Idol of Mork - under the Green God's stony gaze it has been imbued with great power.

name: Rampager's Standard
text: The Rampager’s Standard is so-called as those that wield it in battle are always the most desperate to cross the field and charge the enemy!

name: Ranger's Standard
text: The Ranger’s Standard grants beings under its banner the agility and the wherewithal to scout ahead of the enemy.

name: Razor Standard
text: Regiments or mobs that fly the Razor Standard will slice through enemy armour and penetrate the their opponents' flesh far easier.

name: Standard of Discipline
text: Those who go to war with the Standard of Discipline do so under the stern glare of the figure upon the banner and know that they should continue fighting rather than rout.

name: Steel Standard
text: The arcane sigils woven into the fabric of the banner blaze brightly in the presence of metal, altering heavy, cumbersome armour, making it as light as a feather.

name: The Bad Moon Banner
text: When the leering yellow face of the Bad Moon Banner rises, all Night Goblins swell with an insane blend of daring and battle-madness!

name: Wailing Banner
text: Those who walk under the Wailing Banner know that their enemies will quiver in fear, for the dread face upon the banner wails and moans - instilling terror!

name: War Banner
text: The War Banner is an age-old standard that has been soaked in blood and battle - a testament to endless war.

name: Mark of Nurgle
text: The Mark of Nurgle often manifests as a cluster of warts and buboes. Its bearers are accompanied by a miasma of pestilence.

name: Mark of Slaanesh
text: The Mark of Slaanesh emboldens its bearers, desensitising them to the most perverse and vilest scenarios until even the goriest sights fill them with glee.

name: Mark of Tzeentch
text: Those that bear an ever-burning Mark of Tzeentch have a natural capacity to manipulate magic and a strong prescience for seeing multiple fates.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded warhorses of Bretonnia are grand beasts, dressed in barding to give greater protection to their magic-wielding riders.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded warhorses of Bretonnia are grand beasts, dressed in barding to give greater protection to their magic-wielding riders.

name: Warhorse
text: The chargers of Bretonnia are arguably the finest horses in the Old World, mounts fit for beautiful Damsels to ride into battle.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded warhorses of Bretonnia are grand beasts, dressed in barding to give greater protection to their magic-wielding riders.

name: Warhorse
text: The chargers of Bretonnia are arguably the finest horses in the Old World, mounts fit for beautiful Damsels to ride into battle.

name: Warhorse
text: The chargers of Bretonnia are arguably the finest horses in the Old World, mounts fit for beautiful Damsels to ride into battle.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The Dukes of Bretonnia will command their hosts of Knights from the backs of mighty barded steeds.

name: Hippogryph
text: Taming a mighty Hippogryph presents a challenge that many Bretonnian lords cannot turn down.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded warhorses of Bretonnia are grand beasts, dressed in barding to give greater protection to their magic-wielding riders.

name: Beaquis
text: Beaquis is the loyal mount of King Louen - a mighty Hippogryph as majestic in battle as his master.

name: Royal Pegasus
text: The purest of all Pegasi, legend has it that they descend from Glorfinial, the mighty steed of a Grail Companion.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.

name: Pegasus
text: A Pegasus is stronger and faster than even the mightiest warhorse, and the beast can fly, able to take his rider high into the air to battle in the skies.

name: Dorghar
text: Archaon rides the Steed of the Apocalypse, a great Daemonic stallion known as Dorghar.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Manticore
text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

name: Barded Chaos Steed
text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

name: Chaos Steed
text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The large, broad steeds favoured by the Knights and nobles of the Empire have a temperament to match their size.

name: Quicksilver
text: Gelt’s Pegasus is a mighty and noble creature; a flying steed ready to whisk his master into or out of trouble at the Patriarch’s command.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: While not as thoroughbred as the steeds of Bretonnia, the Empire can still supply its Captains with large barded horses, fit for war.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The large, broad steeds favoured by the Knights and nobles of the Empire have a temperament to match their size.

name: Imperial Griffon
text: A Griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: The Emperor will not meet every fight on Deathclaw, sometimes a more subtle approach is needed, so he travels on a barded steed.

name: Deathclaw
text: Karl Franz often rides to battle on the back of Deathclaw, reputed to be the mightiest Imperial griffon that ever lived.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: The Emperor has access to myriad steeds and mounts from the Imperial Zoo, one such beast is a noble Imperial Pegasus.

name: Warhorse
text: It is a rare sight, but Karl Franz will make use of one of his nation’s fine warhorses if needed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

name: Imperial Pegasus
text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Upon the back of a fine barded stallion, a Warrior Priest will speed down the Empire’s roads bringing word of Sigmar’s wrath.

name: Warhorse
text: Many Warrior Priests are itinerants, moving from town to village preaching Sigmar’s word, and so in battle they will ride too.

name: Skullmuncha
text: Azhag’s pet wyvern is called Skullmuncha - a gift from the Night Goblins of Red Eye Mountain. The wyvern was fierce, but Azhag immediately calmed the beast with one of his “best glares”; the two have been inseparable ever since.

name: Giant Spider
text: Giant spiders are about the size of wolves but with four more legs and many more eyes!

name: Giant Wolf
text: The larger wolves are bred by gobbos to pull their ramshackle chariots and be mounts for their cruel Bosses and nasty Shamans.

name: Giant Wolf
text: The larger wolves are bred by gobbos to pull their ramshackle chariots and be mounts for their cruel Bosses and nasty Shamans.

name: War Boar
text: The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

name: Wyvern
text: Wyverns are occasionally mistaken for dragons but there is little nobility of spirit in these winged beasts, making them kindred spirits for their Orc riders.

name: War Boar
text: The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Captains of Kislev, much like their Empire counterparts, will ride grand, barded warhorses into battle.

name: Warhorse
text: An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: While few Boyars are known to ride on the back of bears in battle, there are many Gospodars that will take barded warhorse in honour of the Winged Lancers.

name: Warhorse
text: To traverse the harsh steppes of Kislev, a valiant steed is always best.

name: Warhorse
text: Not all horses that roam the northlands are Chaos steeds, but even mortal stallions from the north are proud beasts worthy of any Lord.

name: Warhorse
text: Not all horses that roam the northlands are Chaos steeds, but even mortal stallions from the north are proud beasts worthy of any Chieftain.

name: Warhorse
text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded horses offer greater protection; a large horse is needed to support the armour rig, usually purchased from massive breeds found in the Empire.

name: Warhorse
text: Officers of the lesser kingdoms will use their considerable wealth to purchase fine Bretonnian stallions, befitting their standing.

name: Barded Warhorse
text: Barded horses offer greater protection, a large horse is needed to support the armour, usually purchased from massive breeds found in the Empire.

name: Warhorse
text: Officers of the lesser kingdoms will use their considerable wealth to purchase fine Bretonnian stallions, befitting their standing.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are winged Nightmares; Mannfred’s personal mount is said to have been the horse of an arch enemy.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Mannfred has taken to flying into battle upon the back of a mighty zombie dragon, a drake he recently slew and returned to Unlife.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: A powerful Necromancer may be deemed worthy to ride on once-proud steeds, now risen to become Nightmares clad in dread barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Should the Necromancers please their Vampire masters they may well be gifted with Hellsteeds - winged Nightmares.

name: Nightmare
text: Some Nightmares are the long-dead carcasses of dead warhorses, brought back to life through necromantic magic.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

name: Zombie Dragon
text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

name: Barded Skeletal Steed
text: A Wight King was once a Chieftain or a warrior-king of his tribe and so may have been buried with a loyal steed that still wears its rusted barding.

name: Skeletal Steed
text: The Wight King calls forth a spectral steed of bone to ride upon, should he have favoured it during his once-lived life.

name: Rune of Battle
text: During the Golden Age, a Rune of Battle would be seen on Dwarf Banners from many Holds, for the Clans were always thirsty for war.

name: Rune of Courage
text: Those that have the Rune of Courage will never fear the horrors they face.

name: Rune of Sanctuary
text: This rune magnifies the natural anti-magic aura already residing inside each and every Dwarf.

name: Rune of Stoicism
text: Dwarfs are stubborn. The Rune of Stoicism amplifies this, reminding them never to back down no matter who they face.

name: Master Rune of Valaya
text: This ancient rune of protection was first fashioned by the Ancestor Goddess Valaya herself.

name: Rune of Fury
text: Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.

name: Rune of Might
text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.

name: Rune of Parrying
text: A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.

name: Rune of Striking
text: The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.

name: Strollaz' Rune
text: Troops that bear this rune are not restricted by the bounds of their army's deployment zone.

name: Amulet of Sea Gold
text: This ancient Elven heirloom glows with protective energies that become increasingly more powerful in the presence of evil sorcery.

name: Dawnstone
text: A precious stone that glows at the break of every dawn, its bearer is said to be protected by an invisible field.

name: Dragon Cloak of Fyrskar
text: This cloak is made from the skin of the fierce dragon Fyrskar - now an heirloom of Karak Kadrin and a symbol of vows already fulfilled.

name: Dragonbane Gem
text: The Dragonbane Gem was found in the gullet of the legendary drake, Helorgondrax. The beast had choked on the stone in mid-flight and crashed into a Halfling feasting hall at supper time.

name: Luckstone
text: Those that carry the Luckstone are said to cheat fate, for a time at any rate.

name: Obsidian Amulet
text: This jet-black amulet is said to contain a bound djinn, who will deflect enemy magic.

name: Obsidian Lodestone
text: The lodestone of pure obsidian contains many dark djinn, imprisoned by a sultan-sorcerer whose name is lost to time. It is a powerful anti-magic artefact.

name: Obsidian Trinket
text: The barest essence of a djinn, captured within black obsidian, is enough to weaken enemy spells.

name: Talisman of Endurance
text: Those that wear the Talisman of Endurance can tolerate wounds and pain and suffering far in excess of mortal norms.

name: Talisman of Preservation
text: The gleaming Talisman of Preservation gives its wearer the ability to shrug off mortal wounds.

name: Talisman of Protection
text: This is a silver talismanic device worn on a chain that is said to deflect killing blows or sure-striking arrows on occasion.

name: The Dragon Crown of Karaz
text: The Dragon Crown has been worn by the High King since the founding of Karaz-a-Karak.

name: The Eye of Sheerian
text: Named after the Tzeentchian Sorcerer who discovered it, the Eye sees nearly all. Its current owner should make use of its prophetic powers...

name: The Silver Seal
text: Created by the warrior mage, Fredrik von Tarnus, the Silver Seal wards away harmful blows and fell sorceries.

name: Basha's Axe of Stunty Smashin'
text: A massive axe bathed in the spiteful magicks of the Night Goblins, it is a weapon to bring home all their curses upon the stunties.

name: Battleaxe of the Last Waaagh!
text: The infamous event known as Ragnarork will see the world destroyed in an orgy of fire and slaughter at the hands of the Greenskins. This is rumoured to be the axe that will kick it all off. Best swing it with caution… or not!

name: Berserker Sword
text: This blade constantly drips with blood as if only just pulled from a corpse - those that wield it scream with rage, demanding to feed the sword its next victim.

name: Biting Blade
text: The jagged edge of the biting blade ensures that even the strongest armour struggles to repel this weapon.

name: Fencer's Blades
text: An enchanted duo of blades - one long and one short - give the wielder a dazzling array of skilful moves, to parry and deceive an opponent.

name: Giant Blade
text: A massive sword that is still surprisingly versatile to use in combat. Nevertheless, when it strikes it can cleave a foe in twain.

name: Gold Sigil Sword
text: This golden sword gifts its user with a foresight and speed in combat that no mortal should ever have.

name: Obsidian Blade
text: A blade made of darkest obsidian with an edge that is said to not exist in this mortal plane - no armour can stand against it.

name: Ogre Blade
text: The Ogre Blade was used by Chaos Dwarfs to tame the kingdoms amongst the Mountains of Mourn. How it came to the Old World is a mystery.

name: Red Axe of Karak Eight Peaks
text: The Red Axe was forged in Karak Eight Peaks, its vengeful runes made to destroy all Greenskins and vermin.

name: Relic Sword
text: The Relic Sword was discovered in an ancient barrow close to the swamps of Mourkain. There are not many beings that can shrug off a wound from this blade.

name: Shrieking Blade
text: This blade was stolen from a Tomb Banshee while she sang a haunting nursery tale to a forgotten child. Now the blade sings too, and shrieks when it strikes a foe.

name: Slagga's Slashas
text: Slagga’s crude twin blades don’t just enable Azhag to enthusiastically slash up anyone who gets close, but also motivate da boyz to follow suit.

name: Sliverslash
text: It is said Prince Sigvald’s ornate sword is forged from a sliver of Slaanesh’s own blade.

name: Stave of Ruinous Corruption
text: Imbued with the quiddity of Ruin, Morghur's gnarled staff summons deadly Chaos Spawn to do his bidding on the battlefield.

name: Sword of Battle
text: The Sword of Battle is a battered weapon, yet its many owners always remark upon how easy it is to wield in a fight.

name: Sword of Bloodshed
text: A sword tinged red, for wherever it is swung bloodshed is guaranteed, with multiple foes falling in a single deadly arc.

name: Sword of Might
text: The Sword of Might is a grand blade in a rich pommel that imbues its owners with a boon of strength in the heat of battle.

name: Sword of Strife
text: The Sword of Strife never has an owner for long, for those who wield it will always find it in their hand when their temper rises.

name: Sword of Striking
text: Found in the hands of a long-dead guardian, this sword guides its user, making them a much better fighter.

name: Sword of Swift Slaying
text: A sword of silver that never dims. When used in anger, the sword arm of its owner darts forth before an opponent can even raise their guard.

name: The Axe of Grimnir
text: Before Grimnir disappeared into the north, he gifted his son Morgrim one of his legendary axes. It has been passed down to each High King ever since.

name: Armour of Glimril Scales
text: Replicated by Runesmiths from a single scale wedged between the teeth of a slain Chaos Lord at the pivotal Battle of Thraag, the White Dwarf's armour is able to deflect even the hardest blows.

name: Rune Helm of Zhufbar
text: Long thought lost to time and conflict, Grombrindal's awesome helm inspires already-courageous Dwarfen hearts to even greater acts of bravery.

name: Rune of Fury
text: Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.

name: Rune of Might
text: A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.

name: Rune of Parrying
text: A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.

name: Rune of Striking
text: The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with an uncanny precision.

name: Cloak of Valaya
text: Grombrindal's cloak was woven by Valaya herself as a token of the love she felt for the White Dwarf, as proven by the skill in needlework displayed.

name: Rune Axe of Grombrindal
text: Mentioned in several sagas and legends, could the White Dwarf's mighty weapon be the fabled rune axe wielded by Grimnir at the dawn of history?

name: Blood Chalice of Bathori
text: The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.

name: Barded Nightmare
text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

name: Hellsteed
text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.
